original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: evaṃ satatayuktā ye bhaktās tvāṃ paryupāsate /
analyzed: evam satata yuktāḥ ye bhaktāḥ tvām paryupāsate
translated: Those who are thus always devoted and worship You,

original: ye cāpy akṣaram avyaktaṃ teṣāṃ ke yogavittamāḥ ////
analyzed: ye ca api akṣaram avyaktam teṣām ke yoga vittamāḥ
translated: and those who meditate on the imperishable, unmanifest - who among them are the best knowers of yoga?

original: śrīdharaḥ 🔽nirguṇopāsanasyaivaṃ saguṇopāsanasya ca /
analyzed: nirguṇa upāsanasya evam sa guṇa upāsanasya ca
translated: Shridhar

original: śreyaḥ katarad ity etan nirṇetuṃ dvādaśodyamaḥ //🔽pūrvādhyāyānte matkarmakṛn matparama Gītā / ity evaṃ bhaktiniṣṭhasya śreṣṭhatvam uktam /
analyzed: śreyaḥ katarat iti etat nirṇetum dvādaśa udyamaḥ  pūrva adhyāya ante mad karma kṛt mad parama gītāḥ iti evam bhakti niṣṭhasya śreṣṭha tvam uktam
translated: Thus, the twelfth chapter is undertaken to determine which is better,🔽devotion to the formless or devotion to the one with form.🔽At the end of the previous chapter, it was said that one who performs actions for Me, who is devoted to Me, is the best.

original: kaunteya pratijānīhīty Gītā / ādinā ca tatra tatra tasyaiva śreṣṭhatvaṃ nirṇītam /
analyzed: kaunteya pratijānīhi iti gītā ādinā ca tatra tatra tasya eva śreṣṭha tvam nirṇītam
translated: And in the beginning of this chapter, it was said that one who is devoted to Me, who is always united with Me, is the best.

original: tathā teṣāṃ jñānī nityayukta ekabhaktir viśiṣyata Gītā / ity ādinā sarvaṃ jñānaplavenaiva vṛjinaṃ santariṣyasi Gītā / ity ādinā
analyzed: tathā teṣām jñānī nitya yuktaḥ eka bhaktiḥ viśiṣyata gītāḥ iti ādinā sarvam jñāna plavena eva vṛjinam santariṣyasi gītāḥ iti ādinā
translated: Similarly, it was said that one who is wise, always united, and has single devotion is the best, and that one will cross over all difficulties by the boat of knowledge alone.

original: ca jñānaniṣṭhasya śreṣṭhatvam uktam /
analyzed: ca jñāna niṣṭhasya śreṣṭha tvam uktam
translated: Thus, it was said that one who is devoted to knowledge is the best.

original: evam ubhayoḥ śraiṣṭhye 'pi viśeṣajijñāsayā śrībhagavantaṃ praty arjuna uvāca evam iti /
analyzed: evam ubhayoḥ śraiṣṭhye viśeṣa jijñāsayā śrī bhagavantam prati arjunaḥ uvāca evam iti
translated: Thus, even though both are excellent, Arjuna asked the Lord, Thus... out of a desire to know the difference.

original: evaṃ sarvakarmārpaṇādinā satatayuktās tvanniṣṭhāḥ santo ye bhaktās tvāṃ viśvarūpaṃ sarvajñaṃ sarvaśaktiṃ paryupāsate dhyāyanti /
analyzed: evam sarva karma arpaṇa ādinā satata yuktāḥ tvad niṣṭhāḥ santaḥ ye bhaktāḥ tvām viśvarūpam sarvajñam sarva śaktim paryupāsate dhyāyanti
translated: Thus, those devotees who are ever-engaged, who are devoted to You, by offering all actions and so on, and who worship You, the all-pervading, omniscient, omnipotent one,

original: ye cāpy akṣaraṃ brahmāvyaktaṃ nirviśeṣam upāsate /
analyzed: ye ca api akṣaram brahma avyaktam nirviśeṣam upāsate
translated: and those who worship the imperishable Brahman, the unmanifest, the attributeless,

original: teṣām ubhayeṣāṃ madhye ke 'tiśayena yogavido 'tiśreṣṭhā ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: teṣām ubhayeṣām madhye ke tiśayena yoga vidaḥ ti śreṣṭhāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: among these two groups, who are the most excellent knowers of Yoga, is the meaning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ pūrvādhyāyānte
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ pūrva adhyāya ante
translated: Madhusudana: At the end of the previous chapter,

original: matkarmakṛn matparamo madbhaktaḥ saṅgavarjitaḥ /
analyzed: mad karma kṛt mad paramaḥ mad bhaktaḥ saṅga varjitaḥ
translated: The one who does actions for Me, who is devoted to Me, who is a devotee of Mine, who is free from attachment,

original: nirvairaḥ sarvabhūteṣu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava //
analyzed: nirvairaḥ sarva bhūteṣu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava
translated: who is free from enmity towards all beings, he comes to Me, O son of Pandu.

original: Gītā / ity uktam /
analyzed: gītāḥ iti uktam
translated: Gita. This was said.

original: tatra macchabdārthe sandehaḥ kiṃ nirākāram eva sarvasvarūpaṃ vastu madchabdenoktaṃ bhagavatā kiṃ vā sākāram iti /
analyzed: tatra mad śabda arthe sandehaḥ kim nirākāram eva sarva svarūpam vastu mad śabdena uktam bhagavatā kim vā sa ākāram iti
translated: There is doubt about the meaning of the word My: Does the Lord refer to the formless reality that is of the nature of all, by the word My, or does He refer to the reality with form?

original: ubhayatrāpi prayogadarśanāt /
analyzed: ubhayatra api prayoga darśanāt
translated: Because usage is seen in both ways.

original: bahūnāṃ janmanām ante jñānavān māṃ prapadyate /
analyzed: bahūnām janmanām ante jñānavān mām prapadyate
translated: At the end of many births, the wise one attains Me,

original: vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā sudurlabhaḥ // Gītā /
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su durlabhaḥ gītā
translated: Vasudeva is all, that great soul is very difficult to find. Gita.

original: ity ādau nirākāraṃ vastu vyapadiṣṭam /
analyzed: iti ādau nirākāram vastu vyapadiṣṭam
translated: In this and other places, the formless reality is indicated.

original: viśvarūpadarśanānantaraṃ ca
analyzed: viśvarūpa darśana anantaram ca
translated: And after the vision of the universal form,

original: nāhaṃ vedair na tapasā na dānena na cejyayā /
analyzed: na aham vedaiḥ na tapasā na dānena na ca ijyayā
translated: I cannot be seen by the Vedas, by austerities, by gifts, or by sacrifices,

original: śakya evaṃvidho draṣṭuṃ dṛṣṭavān asi māṃ yathā // Gītā /
analyzed: śakyaḥ evaṃvidhaḥ draṣṭum dṛṣṭavān asi mām yathā gītā
translated: in this way, as you have seen Me. (Gita 11.53)

original: iti sākāraṃ vastu /
analyzed: iti sa ākāram vastu
translated: Thus, the object with form.

original: ubhayoś ca bhagavadupadeśayor adhikāribhedenaiva vyavasthayā bhavitavyam anyathā virodhāt /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ ca bhagavat upadeśayoḥ adhikāri bhedena eva vyavasthayā bhavitavyam anyathā virodhāt
translated: And both of the Lord's teachings must be established by the difference of the qualified persons, otherwise there would be a contradiction.

original: tatraivaṃ sati mayā mumukṣuṇā kiṃ nirākāram eva vastu cintanīyaṃ kiṃ vā sākāram iti svādhikāraniścayāya saguṇanirguṇavidyayor viśeṣabubhutsayā
analyzed: tatra evam sati mayā mumukṣuṇā kim nirākāram eva vastu cintanīyam kim vā sa ākāram iti sva adhikāra niścayāya sa guṇa nirguṇa vidyayoḥ viśeṣa bubhutsayā
translated: In that case, having thus become a seeker of liberation, what should I think about the object, only without form, or with form? For the sake of determining one's own qualification, with a desire to know the difference between the Vidyas with and without qualities,

original: arjuna uvāca evam iti /
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca evam iti
translated: Arjuna said: Thus (Gita 11.54).

original: evaṃ matkarmakṛd Gītā / ityādyanantaroktaprakāreṇa satatayuktā nairantaryeṇa
analyzed: evam mad karma kṛt gītā ityādi anantara ukta prakāreṇa satata yuktā nairantaryeṇa
translated: Thus, the devotees who are always engaged, continuously,

original: bhagavatkarmādau sāvadhānatayā pravṛttā bhaktāḥ sākāravastvekaśaraṇāḥ santas
analyzed: bhagavat karma ādau sāvadhāna tayā pravṛttāḥ bhaktāḥ sa ākāra vastu eka śaraṇāḥ
translated: with attention to the Lord's actions and so on, who are solely devoted to the object with form,

original: tvām evaṃvidhaṃ sākāraṃ ye paryupāsate satataṃ cintayanti /
analyzed: tvām evaṃvidham sa ākāram ye paryupāsate satatam cintayanti
translated: and who always meditate on you, who are of this kind, with form,

original: ye cāpi sarvato viraktās tyaktasarvakarmāṇo 'kṣaraṃ na kṣaraty aśnute vety akṣaram
analyzed: ye ca api sarvatas viraktāḥ tyakta sarva karmāṇaḥ kṣaram na kṣarati aśnute vā iti akṣaram
translated: and those who are detached from everything, who have renounced all actions, and who meditate on the Imperishable, which does not perish or decay,

original: etad vai tad akṣaraṃ gārgi brāhmaṇā abhivadanty asthūlam anaṇv ahrasvam adīrgham
analyzed: etat vai tat akṣaram gārgi brāhmaṇāḥ abhivadanti a sthūlam an aṇu a hrasvam a dīrgham
translated: O Gārgi, this is that imperishable Brahman which the Brāhmaṇas declare to be without grossness, without fineness, without length, without shortness,

original: BAU / / ity ādiśrutipratiṣiddhasarvopādhi nirguṇaṃ brahma /
analyzed: iti ādi śruti pratiṣiddha sarva upādhi nirguṇam brahma
translated: without interior, without exterior, without anything like it, without any other,🔽without multiplicity, without darkness, without fear.🔽For this very reason, they worship You, who are devoid of all attributes prohibited by Vedic statements such as imperceptible, beyond the reach of all senses, formless.

original: ataevāvyaktaṃ sarvakaraṇāgocaraṃ nirākāraṃ tvāṃ paryupāsate teṣām ubhayeṣāṃ madhye ke yogavittamāḥ atiśayena yogavidaḥ /
analyzed: ataeva avyaktam sarva karaṇa agocaram nirākāram tvām paryupāsate teṣām ubhayeṣām madhye ke yoga vittamāḥ atiśayena yoga vidaḥ
translated: Among those two groups, who are the foremost knowers of yoga, the knowers of yoga par excellence?

original: yogaṃ samādhiṃ vindanti vidantīti vā yogavida ubhaye 'pi /
analyzed: yogam samādhim vindanti vidanti iti vā yoga vidaḥ ubhaye
translated: Both groups are knowers of yoga, as they find or know yoga, concentration.

original: teṣāṃ madhye ke śreṣṭhā yoginaḥ keṣāṃ jñānaṃ mayānusaraṇīyam ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: teṣām madhye ke śreṣṭhāḥ yoginaḥ keṣām jñānam mayā anusaraṇīyam iti arthaḥ
translated: Among them, who are the best yogis? Whose knowledge should I follow? This is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ
translated: Visvanatha

original: dvādaśe sarvabhaktānāṃ jñānibhyaḥ śraiṣṭhyam ucyate /
analyzed: dvādaśe sarva bhaktānām jñānibhyaḥ śraiṣṭhyam ucyate
translated: In the twelfth chapter, the supremacy of all devotees over the knowers of Brahman is stated.

original: bhakteṣv api praśasyante ye 'dveṣādiguṇānvitāḥ //
analyzed: bhakteṣu api praśasyante ye dveṣa ādi guṇa anvitāḥ
translated: Even among devotees, those endowed with qualities like non-hatred are praised.

original: bhaktiprakaraṇasyopakrame
analyzed: bhakti prakaraṇasya upakrame
translated: At the beginning of the chapter on devotion,

original: yoginām api sarveṣāṃ madgatenāntarātmanā /
analyzed: yoginām api sarveṣām mad gatena antarātmanā
translated: Among all yogis, he who worships Me with a mind fixed on Me,

original: śraddhāvān bhajate yo māṃ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ // Gītā /
analyzed: śraddhāvān bhajate yaḥ mām sa me yuktatamaḥ mataḥ gītā
translated: with faith, is considered by Me to be the most perfectly united. (Bhagavad Gita)

original: iti bhakteḥ sarvotkarṣo yathā śruteḥ /
analyzed: iti bhakteḥ sarva utkarṣaḥ yathā śruteḥ
translated: Thus, devotion is supreme, as stated in the Vedas.

original: tathaivopasaṃhāre 'pi tasyā evaṃ sarvotkarṣaṃ śrotukāmaḥ pṛcchati /
analyzed: tathā eva upasaṃhāre pi tasyāḥ evam sarva utkarṣam śrotu kāmaḥ pṛcchati
translated: Similarly, at the end also, he, being desirous of hearing about her as the most excellent of all, asks.

original: evaṃ satatayuktā matkarmakṛn matparamaḥ Gītā / iti tvaduktalakṣaṇā bhaktās🔽tvāṃ śyāmasundarākāraṃ ye ca avyaktaṃ nirviśeṣam akṣaraṃ etad vai tad akṣaraṃ gārgi
analyzed: evam satata yuktāḥ mad karma kṛt mad paramaḥ gītāḥ iti tvad ukta lakṣaṇāḥ bhaktāḥ  tvām śyāma sundara ākāram ye ca avyaktam nirviśeṣam akṣaram etat vai tat akṣaram gārgi
translated: Thus, those devotees who are always engaged, who perform actions for Me, who are devoted to Me,

original: brāhmaṇā abhivadanty asthūlam anaṇv ahrasvam BAU / / ity ādiśrutyuktaṃ brahma upāsate /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ abhivadanti a sthūlam an aṇu a hrasvam bau iti ādi śruti uktam brahma upāsate
translated: and those who meditate on You, who have the form of a dark handsome youth, and the unmanifest Brahman, which is described in the scriptures as This, O Gārgi, is that imperishable Brahman, which the Brāhmaṇas speak of as being without grossness, without fineness, without length, without shortness, etc.,

original: teṣām ubhayeṣāṃ yogavidāṃ madhye ke 'tiśayena yogavidaś ca tvaprāntau śreṣṭham upāyaṃ jānanti na labhante vā /
analyzed: teṣām ubhayeṣām yoga vidām madhye ke tiśayena yoga vidaḥ ca tva prāntau śreṣṭham upāyam jānanti na labhante vā
translated: among those two kinds of knowers of Yoga, who know the most excellent means to reach You, or who do not obtain it?

original: te yogavittarā iti vaktavye yogavittamā ity uktir yogavittarāṇām api bahūnāṃ madhye ke yogavittamā ity arthaṃ bodhayati ////
analyzed: te yoga vittarāḥ iti vaktavye yoga vittamāḥ iti uktiḥ yoga vittarāṇām api bahūnām madhye ke yoga vittamāḥ iti artham bodhayati
translated: Although it should be said that they are the most excellent knowers of Yoga, the statement the best of the knowers of Yoga indicates that among many who are the most excellent knowers of Yoga, who are the best of the knowers of Yoga?

original: baladevaḥ
analyzed: baladevaḥ
translated: Balarama

original: upāyeṣu samasteṣu śuddhā bhaktir mahābalā /
analyzed: upāyeṣu samasteṣu śuddhā bhaktiḥ mahā balā
translated: Among all the means, pure devotion is very powerful.

original: prāpayet tvarayā yan mām ity āha dvādaśe hariḥ //
analyzed: prāpayet tvarayā yat mām iti āha dvādaśe hariḥ
translated: Hari says in the twelfth chapter that it quickly brings one to Me.

original: jīvātmānaṃ yathāvaj jñātvā vijñāya ca tadaṃśī harir dhyeya iti avināśi tu tad viddhi Gītā / ity ādibhir dvitīyādiṣv ekaḥ panthā varṇitaḥ
analyzed: jīvātmānam yathāvat jñātvā vijñāya ca tad aṃśī hariḥ dhyeyaḥ iti avināśi tu tat viddhi gītāḥ iti ādibhiḥ dvitīya ādiṣu ekaḥ panthāḥ varṇitaḥ
translated: The second path, etc., have been described by such passages as, Having known the individual soul as it is, and having understood Hari, who is a part of that (soul), one should meditate on Him, and But know that to be indestructible (2.17).🔽

original: jīvātmānaṃ harer aṃśaṃ jñātvaiva tadaṃśī haris tacchravaṇādibhaktibhir dhyeya iti mayy āsaktamanāḥ pārtha Gītā / ity ādibhiḥ saptamādiṣu
analyzed: jīvātmānam hareḥ aṃśam jñātvā eva tad aṃśī hariḥ tad śravaṇa ādi bhaktibhiḥ dhyeyaḥ iti mayi āsakta manāḥ pārtha gītāḥ iti ādibhiḥ saptama ādiṣu
translated: In the second chapter etc. it has been described that the one path is: Having known the individual soul as it is, and having understood that it is a part of Hari, Hari, who is the whole, should be meditated upon. But know that to be indestructible, The individual soul, which is a part of Hari, should be known, and then Hari, who is the whole, should be meditated upon by means of devotion such as listening to His glories, etc. With a mind attached to Me, O son of Prtha, etc. In the seventh chapter etc.

original: dvitīyapanthāḥ pradarśitaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīya panthāḥ pradarśitaḥ
translated: The second path has been shown.

original: teṣv eva prayāṇakāle Gītā / ity ādinā yogopasṛṣṭā /
analyzed: teṣu eva prayāṇa kāle gītāḥ iti ādinā yoga upasṛṣṭā
translated: In those very [verses], At the time of departure, etc., devotion accompanied by yoga has been mentioned.

original: jñānayajñena cāpy anye Gītā / ity anena jñānopasṛṣṭā ca bhaktir uktā /
analyzed: jñāna yajñena ca api anye gītāḥ iti anena jñāna upasṛṣṭā ca bhaktiḥ uktā
translated: And by And others by the sacrifice of knowledge, etc., devotion accompanied by knowledge has been mentioned.

original: bhaktiṣaṭkāt prāk ṣaṣṭhānte kevalāṃ bhaktim upadekṣyatā yoginām api sarveṣāṃ Gītā / ity ādipadyena svaikāntinām yuktatamatāṃ cābhihitā
analyzed: bhakti ṣaṭkāt prāk ṣaṣṭha ante kevalām bhaktim upadekṣyatā yoginām api sarveṣām gītā iti ādi padyena sva ekāntinām yuktatama tām ca abhihitā
translated: Before the six kinds of devotion, at the end of the sixth, devotion alone is taught by the verse beginning Of all yogis, etc., and the state of being most fit for the devotees of the Lord is stated.

original: tatrārjunaḥ pṛcchati evam iti /
analyzed: tatra arjunaḥ pṛcchati evam iti
translated: There Arjuna asks: Thus.

original: evaṃ mayy āsaktamanāḥ pārtha Gītā / ity āditvaduktavidhayā satatayuktā ye tvāṃ śyāmasundaraṃ kṛṣṇaṃ
analyzed: evam mayi āsakta manāḥ pārtha gītāḥ iti ādi tvad ukta vidhayā satata yuktāḥ ye tvām śyāma sundaram kṛṣṇam
translated: Thus, With a mind attached to Me, O son of Prtha, etc., those who are always devoted to You, the dark and handsome Krishna,

original: paritaḥ kāyādivyāpārair upāsate /
analyzed: paritas kāya ādi vyāpāraiḥ upāsate
translated: They serve with the activities of the body etc. all around.

original: ye cākṣaraṃ jīvasvarūpaṃ cakṣurādibhir avyaktaṃ paryupāsate dhāraṇādhyānasamādhibhiḥ
analyzed: ye ca akṣaram jīva svarūpam cakṣuḥ ādibhiḥ avyaktam paryupāsate dhāraṇā dhyāna samādhibhiḥ
translated: And those who serve the imperishable, the form of the individual soul, which is unmanifest to the eyes etc., with concentration, meditation and samadhi,

original: sākṣātkartum īhante paramātmakāmās teṣām ubhayeṣāṃ madhye yogavittamāḥ śīghropāyinaḥ ke bhavanti /
analyzed: sākṣātkartum īhante paramātma kāmāḥ teṣām ubhayeṣām madhye yoga vittamāḥ śīghra upāyinaḥ ke bhavanti
translated: desiring the supreme self, among those two groups, who are the best knowers of yoga, who have the quickest means?

original: ayaṃ bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea:

original: svānubhavapūrvakasya haridhyānasya bandhamūlatvāt tena nirvighnā tatprāptir ity eke /
analyzed: sva anubhava pūrvakasya hari dhyānasya bandha mūla tvāt tena nirvighnā tad prāptiḥ iti eke
translated: Some say that since meditation on Hari preceded by one's own experience is the root of bondage, attainment of Him without obstacles is by that.

original: nīrūpasyātisūkṣmasya jīvātmano durdhyānatvāt kiṃ taddhyānena /
analyzed: nīrūpasya ati sūkṣmasya jīvātmanaḥ durdhyāna tvāt kim tad dhyānena
translated: Some say that since the formless, extremely subtle individual soul is difficult to meditate upon, what is the use of meditating on that?

original: kintu haribhaktir eva sarvavighnavimardinī hariprāpaṇīty eke /
analyzed: kintu hari bhaktiḥ eva sarva vighna vimardinī hari prāpaṇī iti eke
translated: But devotion to Hari alone crushes all obstacles and leads to the attainment of Hari.

original: tasyām eva niratās teṣām ubhayeṣām upāyeṣu kaḥ śreyān upāya iti taṃ bhaṇeti ////
analyzed: tasyām eva niratāḥ teṣām ubhayeṣām upāyeṣu kaḥ śreyān upāyaḥ iti tam bhaṇa iti
translated: Among those two groups engaged in that alone, which is the best means? Please tell me.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca🔽mayy āveśya mano ye māṃ nityayuktā upāsate /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca  mayi āveśya manaḥ ye mām nitya yuktāḥ upāsate
translated: The Blessed Lord said:🔽Those who, fixing their minds on Me, always devoted, worship Me,

original: śraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ ////
analyzed: śraddhayā parayā upetāḥ te me yuktatamāḥ matāḥ
translated: endowed with supreme faith, they are considered by Me to be the most united with Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ tatra prathamāḥ śreṣṭhā ity uttaraṃ śrībhagavān uvāca mayīti /
analyzed: uvāca   iti
translated: Sri Sridhara: In reply to the question, Who are the best devotees? the Supreme Personality of Godhead says, Those who...

original: mayi parameśvare sarvajñādiguṇaviśiṣṭe /
analyzed: mayi parameśvare sarvajña ādi guṇa viśiṣṭe
translated: In Me, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is endowed with the qualities of omniscience and so on.

original: mana āveśyaikāgraṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: manaḥ āveśya ekāgram kṛtvā
translated: Having fixed the mind, making it one-pointed.

original: nityayuktā madarthakarmānuṣṭhānādinā manniṣṭhāḥ santaḥ śreṣṭhayā śraddhayā yuktā ye mām ārādhayanti te yuktatamā mamābhimatāḥ ////
analyzed: nitya yuktāḥ mad artha karma anuṣṭhāna ādinā manniṣṭhāḥ santaḥ śreṣṭhayā śraddhayā yuktāḥ ye mām ārādhayanti te yuktatamāḥ mama abhimatāḥ
translated: Always devoted, being absorbed in Me by performing actions for My sake, those who worship Me with the best faith are the best devotees, most dear to Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana🔽Visvanatha: In reply to the question, Who are the best devotees? He says, Those who...

original: viśvanāthaḥ tatra madbhaktāḥ śreṣṭhā ity āha mayi śyāmasundarākāre mama āveśyāviṣṭaṃ kṛtvā nityayuktā mannityayogakāṅkṣiṇaḥ parayā 🔽guṇātītayā śraddhayā / yad uktaṃ
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ tatra mad bhaktāḥ śreṣṭhāḥ iti āha mayi śyāma sundara ākāre mama āveśya āviṣṭam kṛtvā nitya yuktāḥ mad nitya yoga kāṅkṣiṇaḥ parayā  guṇa atītayā śraddhayā yat uktam
translated: Having fixed the mind in Me, in My form as the dark and handsome one, making it absorbed, always devoted, desiring constant devotion to Me, with the best faith, which is beyond the modes of nature. As it is said:

original: sāttviky ādhyātmikī śraddhā karmaśraddhā tu rājasī /🔽tāmasy adharme yā śraddhā matsevāyāṃ tu nirguṇā // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: sāttvikī ādhyātmikī śraddhā karma śraddhā tu rājasī  tāmasī adharme yā śraddhā mad sevāyām tu nirguṇā
translated: Faith in spiritual matters is in the mode of goodness. Faith in fruitive work is in the mode of passion.🔽Faith in irreligion is in the mode of ignorance. But faith in serving Me is beyond the modes.

original: te me madīyā ananyabhaktā yuktatamā yogavittamā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: te me madīyāḥ ananya bhaktāḥ yuktatamāḥ yoga vittamāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: They are My devotees, not devotees of anyone else. They are the best devotees, the best knowers of yoga.

original: tenānanyabhaktebhyo nyūnā anye jñānakarmādimiśrabhaktimanto yogavittarā ity artho 'bhivyañjito bhavati /
analyzed: tena ananya bhaktebhyaḥ nyūnāḥ anye jñāna karma ādi miśra bhaktimantaḥ yoga vittarāḥ iti arthaḥ bhivyañjitaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, it is made clear that others who have devotion mixed with knowledge, action, etc. are inferior to those who are solely devoted.

original: tataś ca jñānād bhaktiḥ śreṣṭhā bhaktāv apy ananyabhaktiḥ śreṣṭhety upapāditam ////🔽baladevaḥ evaṃ pṛṣṭho bhagavān uvāca mayīti /
analyzed: tatas ca jñānāt bhaktiḥ śreṣṭhā bhaktau api ananya bhaktiḥ śreṣṭhā iti upapāditam  baladevaḥ evam pṛṣṭhaḥ bhagavān uvāca mayi iti
translated: And hence it is established that devotion is superior to knowledge, and among devotions, devotion to the Supreme Lord alone is the best.

original: ye bhaktā mayi nīlotpalaśyāmalatvādidharmiṇi svayaṃ bhagavati devakīsūnau mana āveśya nirataṃ kṛtvā parayā dṛḍhayā śraddhayopetāḥ santo
analyzed: ye bhaktāḥ mayi nīlotpala śyāmala tva ādi dharmiṇi svayam bhagavati devakī sūnau manaḥ āveśya niratam kṛtvā parayā dṛḍhayā śraddhayā upetāḥ santaḥ
translated: The powerful Lord, thus asked, said: Those who are endowed with supreme, firm faith, having fixed their mind on Me, on the Supreme Lord, the son of Devaki, who is dark like a blue lotus, etc.,

original: mām uktalakṣaṇam upāsate /
analyzed: mām ukta lakṣaṇam upāsate
translated: and worship Me, as described,

original: śravaṇādilakṣaṇām upāsanāṃ mama kurvanti /
analyzed: śravaṇa ādi lakṣaṇām upāsanām mama kurvanti
translated: who perform the worship of Me, characterized by hearing, etc.,

original: nityayuktā nityaṃ madyogam icchantas te mama matena yuktatamā matāḥ /
analyzed: nitya yuktāḥ nityam mad yogam icchantaḥ te mama matena yuktatamāḥ matāḥ
translated: who are always devoted, desiring constant union with Me, they are considered by Me to be the most fit.

original: śīghramatprāpakopāyinas te ////
analyzed: śīghra mad prāpaka upāyinaḥ te
translated: They are the means of quickly attaining Me.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg

original: ye tv akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktaṃ paryupāsate /🔽sarvatragam acintyaṃ ca kūṭastham acalaṃ dhruvam ////
analyzed: ye tu akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktam paryupāsate  sarvatragam acintyam ca kūṭastham acalam dhruvam
translated: But those who worship the Imperishable, the Indescribable, the Unmanifest,🔽Omnipresent, Inconceivable, the Immutable, the Immovable, the Firm One,

original: saṃniyamyendriyagrāmaṃ sarvatra samabuddhayaḥ /
analyzed: saṃniyamya indriya grāmam sarvatra sama buddhayaḥ
translated: Having controlled the group of senses, with an equal mind everywhere,

original: te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ ////
analyzed: te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva bhūta hite ratāḥ
translated: They, devoted to the welfare of all beings, attain Me alone.

original: śrīdharaḥ tarhītare kiṃ na śreṣṭhā iti /🔽ata āha ye tv iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: atas āha ye tu iti dvābhyām
translated: Śrīdhara: If it is asked, Then are not the others the best?,🔽to answer that, he says with two verses, But those who worship the Imperishable...

original: ye tv akṣaram paryupāsate dhyāyanti te 'pi mām eva prāpnuvantīti dvayor anvayaḥ /
analyzed: ye tu akṣaram paryupāsate dhyāyanti te mām eva prāpnuvanti iti dvayoḥ anvayaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they also attain Me.

original: akṣarasya lakṣaṇam anirdeśyam ity ādi /
analyzed: akṣarasya lakṣaṇam anirdeśyam ityādi
translated: The definition of the Imperishable is given by indescribable... etc.

original: anirdeśyaṃ śabdena nirdeṣṭum aśakyam /
analyzed: anirdeśyam śabdena nirdeṣṭum aśakyam
translated: It is indescribable - incapable of being described by words.

original: yato 'vyaktaṃ rūpādihīnam /
analyzed: yatas vyaktam rūpa ādi hīnam
translated: Because it is unmanifest - devoid of form etc.

original: sarvatragaṃ sarvavyāpi /
analyzed: sarvatragam sarva vyāpi
translated: It is all-pervading - pervading everything.

original: avyaktatvād evācintyam /
analyzed: avyakta tvāt eva acintyam
translated: It is inconceivable because of being unmanifest.

original: kūṭasthaṃ kūṭe māyāprapañce 'dhiṣṭhānatvenāvasthitam /
analyzed: kūṭastham kūṭe māyā prapañce dhiṣṭhāna tvena avasthitam
translated: It is unchanging - existing as the basis in the illusory world.

original: acalaṃ spandanarahitam /
analyzed: acalam spandana rahitam
translated: It is motionless - devoid of vibration.

original: ataeva dhruvaṃ nityaṃ vṛddhyādirahitam /
analyzed: atas eva dhruvam nityam vṛddhi ādi rahitam
translated: For that very reason, it is eternal - devoid of increase etc.

original: spaṣṭam anyat ////
analyzed: spaṣṭam anyat
translated: The rest is clear.

original: madhusūdanaḥ nirguṇabrahmavidapekṣayā saguṇabrahmavidāṃ ko 'tiśayo yena ta
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ nirguṇa brahma vid apekṣayā saguṇa brahma vidām kaḥ atiśayaḥ yena te
translated: Madhusudana: In comparison to the knowers of Brahman without qualities, what is the superiority of the knowers of Brahman with qualities, by which they alone are considered to be of the nature of Yoga by you?

original: eva yuktatmās tavābhimatā ity apekṣāyāṃ tam atiśayaṃ vaktuṃ tan nirūpakān nirguṇabrahmavidaḥ
analyzed: eva tava abhimatāḥ iti apekṣāyām tam atiśayam vaktum tat nirūpakān nirguṇa brahma vidaḥ
translated: When this is expected, in order to state that superiority, he introduces the knowers of Brahman without qualities, who are the subjects of that,

original: prastauti ye tv iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: prastauti ye tu iti dvābhyām
translated: with two verses beginning with But those who...

original: ye 'kṣaram mām upāsate te 'pi mām eva prāpnuvantīti dvitīyagatenānvayaḥ /
analyzed: ye kṣaram mām upāsate te mām eva prāpnuvanti iti dvitīya gatena anvayaḥ
translated: Those who worship Me as the Imperishable also attain Me alone. This is the connection with the second verse.

original: pūrvebhyo vailakṣaṇyadyotanāya tuśabdaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvebhyaḥ vailakṣaṇya dyotanāya tuśabdaḥ
translated: The word but is used to indicate the difference from the previous ones.

original: akṣaraṃ nirviśeṣaṃ brahma vācaknavībrāhmaṇe prasiddhaṃ tasya samarpaṇāya sapta viśeṣaṇāni /
analyzed: akṣaram nirviśeṣam brahma vācaknavībrāhmaṇe prasiddham tasya samarpaṇāya sapta viśeṣaṇāni
translated: The Imperishable Brahman, well-known in the Vācakaṇvī Brāhmaṇa, has seven qualifications for its identification.

original: anirdeśyaṃ śabdena vyapadeṣṭum aśakyaṃ yato 'vyaktaṃ śabdapravṛtter nirviśeṣe pravṛttyayogāt /
analyzed: anirdeśyam śabdena vyapadeṣṭum aśakyam yatas vyaktam śabda pravṛtteḥ nirviśeṣe pravṛtti ayogāt
translated: It is indescribable, incapable of being indicated by words, because it is unmanifest, as the application of words is not possible in what is without distinctions.

original: kuto jātyādirāhityam ata āha sarvatragaṃ sarvavyāpi sarvakāraṇam /
analyzed: kutas jāti ādi rāhityam atas āha sarvatragam sarva vyāpi sarva kāraṇam
translated: From where does the absence of genus etc. come? Therefore it is said: all-pervading, all-pervading, the cause of all.

original: ato jātyādiśūnyaṃ paricchinnasya kāryasyaiva jātyādiyogadarśanāt /
analyzed: atas jāti ādi śūnyam paricchinnasya kāryasya eva jāti ādi yoga darśanāt
translated: Therefore, it is devoid of genus etc., because only limited effects are seen to have genus etc.

original: ākāśādīnām api kāryatvābhyupagamāc ca /
analyzed: ākāśa ādīnām api kārya tva abhyupagamāt ca
translated: And because even space etc. are accepted as effects.

original: ataevācintyaṃ śabdavṛtter iva manovṛtter api na
analyzed: ataeva acintyam śabda vṛtteḥ iva manaḥ vṛtteḥ api na
translated: For this very reason, it is inconceivable, not even the activity of the mind is its object, like the activity of words,

original: viṣayaḥ / tasyā api paricchinnaviṣayatvāt /
analyzed: viṣayaḥ tasyāḥ api paricchinna viṣaya tvāt
translated: because even that has a limited object.

original: yato vāco nivartante /
analyzed: yatas vācaḥ nivartante
translated: From where words turn back.

original: aprāpya manasā saha iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: a prāpya manasā saha iti śruteḥ
translated: Without reaching it, along with the mind. This is stated in the scriptures.

original: tarhi kathaṃ taṃ tv aupaniṣadaṃ puruṣaṃ pṛcchāmi iti /
analyzed: tarhi katham tam tu aupaniṣadam puruṣam pṛcchāmi iti
translated: Then how is it that I ask about that person who is taught in the Upaniṣads?

original: dṛśyate tv agryayā buddhyā iti ca śrutiḥ /
analyzed: dṛśyate tu agryayā buddhyā iti ca śrutiḥ
translated: And the Śruti says, “But it is seen by the highest knowledge.”

original: śāstrayonitvāt iti sūtraṃ ca /🔽ucyate / avidyākalpitasambandhena śabdajanyāyāṃ buddhivṛttau caramāyāṃ paramānandabodharūpe
analyzed: śāstra yoni tvāt iti sūtram ca  ucyate avidyā kalpita sambandhena śabda janyāyām buddhi vṛttau caramāyām paramānanda bodha rūpe
translated: And the aphorism, “Because it is the source of the scriptures.”🔽It is said: In the last stage of the evolution of the intellect, which is produced by words and is connected with ignorance, when the pure reality, which is of the nature of supreme bliss and knowledge,

original: śuddhe vastuni pratibimbite 'vidyātatkāryayoḥ kalpitayor nivṛttyupapatter upacāreṇa
analyzed: śuddhe vastuni pratibimbite vidyā tad kāryayoḥ kalpitayoḥ nivṛtti upapatteḥ upacāreṇa
translated: is reflected, the cessation of ignorance and its effects, which are imagined, is logically possible. Therefore, by figurative

original: viṣayatvābhidhānāt /
analyzed: viṣaya tva abhidhānāt
translated: expression, it is said to be the object.

original: atas tatra kalpitam aivdyāsambandhaṃ pratipādayitum āha kūṭasthaṃ /
analyzed: atas tatra kalpitam aivdya asambandham pratipādayitum āha kūṭastham
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the imagined connection with ignorance there, it is said to be the immutable.

original: yan mithyābhūtaṃ satyatayā pratīyate tatkūṭam iti lokair ucyate /
analyzed: yat mithyābhūtam satya tayā pratīyate tat kūṭam iti lokaiḥ ucyate
translated: That which is false and is perceived as true is called a “trick” by worldly people.

original: yathā kūṭakārṣāpaṇaḥ kūṭasākṣitvam ity ādau /
analyzed: yathā kūṭa kārṣāpaṇaḥ kūṭa sākṣi tvam iti ādau
translated: For example, like a counterfeit coin, or being a false witness, etc.

original: ajñānam api māyākhyaṃ saha kāryaprapañcena mithyābhūtam api laukikaiḥ satyatayā
analyzed: ajñānam api māyā ākhyam saha kārya prapañcena mithyā bhūtam api laukikaiḥ satya tayā
translated: Ignorance, which is called māyā, along with the manifold effects, though false, is perceived by worldly people as true,

original: pratīyamānaṃ kūṭaṃ tasminn ādhyāsikena sambandhenādhiṣṭhānatayā tiṣṭhatīti kūṭastham
analyzed: pratīyamānam kūṭam tasmin ādhyāsikena sambandhena adhiṣṭhāna tayā tiṣṭhati iti kūṭastham
translated: and it abides as a trick in that superimposed connection as the substratum. Therefore it is immutable.

original: ajñānatatkāryādhiṣṭhānam ity arthaḥ /
translated: The meaning is: the substratum of ignorance and its effects.

original: etena sarvānupapattiparihāraḥ
translated: By this, all logical inconsistencies are avoided.

original: kṛtaḥ / ataeva sarvavikārāṇām avidyākalpitatvāt tadadhiṣṭhānam sākṣicaitanyaṃ nirvikāram ity āha acalaṃ calanaṃ vikāraḥ /
analyzed: kṛtaḥ ataeva sarva vikārāṇām avidyā kalpita tvāt tad adhiṣṭhānam sākṣi caitanyam nirvikāram iti āha acalam calanam vikāraḥ
translated: And for that very reason, since all modifications are imagined by ignorance, the consciousness of the witness, which is the basis of that, is without modification. Therefore he says: Unmoving. Moving is modification.

original: acalatvād eva dhruvam apariṇāmi nityam /
analyzed: acala tvāt eva dhruvam apariṇāmi nityam
translated: Because of being unmoving, it is firm, unchanging, eternal.

original: etādṛśaṃ śuddhaṃ brahma māṃ paryupāsate śravaṇena pramāṇagatām asambhāvanām apohya
analyzed: etādṛśam śuddham brahma mām paryupāsate śravaṇena pramāṇa gatām asambhāvanām apohya
translated: Such pure Brahman they worship with me, having removed the disbelief in the means of knowledge by hearing,

original: mananena ca prameyagatām anantaraṃ viparītabhāvanānivṛttaye dhyāyanti vijātīyapratyayatiraskāreṇa🔽tailadhārāvad avicchinnasamānapratyayatiraskāreṇa tailadhārāvad avicchinnasamānapratyayapravāheṇa
analyzed: mananena ca prameya gatām anantaram viparīta bhāvanā nivṛttaye dhyāyanti vijātīya pratyaya tiraskāreṇa  taila dhārā vat avicchinna samāna pratyaya tiraskāreṇa taila dhārā vat avicchinna samāna pratyaya pravāheṇa
translated: and by reflection they meditate in order to remove the contrary conception that follows. By setting aside dissimilar cognitions,🔽by the flow of uninterrupted similar cognitions like the stream of oil,

original: nididhyāsanasaṃjñakena dhyānena viṣayīkurvantity arthaḥ // //
analyzed: nididhyāsana saṃjñakena dhyānena viṣayīkurvanti iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that they make it the object of meditation called nididhyāsana, by the meditation that sets aside the flow of uninterrupted similar cognitions.

original: kathaṃ punar viṣayendriyasaṃyoge sati vijātīyapratyayatiraskāro 'ta āha saṃniyamya svaviṣayebhya upasaṃhṛtyendriyagrāmaṃ karaṇasamudāyam
analyzed: katham punar viṣaya indriya saṃyoge sati vijātīya pratyaya tiraskāro te āha saṃniyamya sva viṣayebhyaḥ upasaṃhṛtya indriya grāmam karaṇa samudāyam
translated: But how, when there is contact between the object and the sense organs, is there the setting aside of dissimilar cognitions? To this he says: Having withdrawn, having collected, the group of sense organs, the collection of instruments, from their own objects,

original: etena śamadamādisampattir uktā /
analyzed: etena śama dama ādi sampattiḥ uktā
translated: By this, the possession of tranquility, self-control, etc. is stated.

original: viṣayabhogavāsanāyāṃ satyāṃ kuta indriyāṇāṃ tato nivṛttis tatrāha sarvatra viṣaye
analyzed: viṣaya bhoga vāsanāyām satyām kutas indriyāṇām tatas nivṛttiḥ tatra āha sarvatra viṣaye
translated: When there is the impression of enjoyment of objects, how can there be withdrawal of the senses from that? In that matter, he says:🔽Those who have an equal mind everywhere,

original: samā tulyā harṣaviṣādābhyāṃ rāgadveṣābhyāṃ ca rahitā matir yeṣāṃ samyagjñānena
analyzed: samā tulyā harṣa viṣādābhyām rāga dveṣābhyām ca rahitā matiḥ yeṣām samyak jñānena
translated: who are free from joy, sorrow, attachment, and aversion, by means of right knowledge,

original: tatkāraṇasyājñānasyāpanītatvād viṣayeṣu doṣadarśanābhyāsena spṛhāyā nirasanāc ca
analyzed: tad kāraṇasya ajñānasya apanīta tvāt viṣayeṣu doṣa darśana abhyāsena spṛhāyāḥ nirasanāt ca
translated: because ignorance, which is the cause of that, has been removed, and because of the removal of longing by the practice of seeing faults in objects,

original: te sarvatra samabuddhayaḥ /
analyzed: te sarvatra sama buddhayaḥ
translated: they are of equal mind everywhere.

original: etena vaśīkārasaṃjñā vairāgyam uktam /
analyzed: etena vaśīkāra saṃjñā vairāgyam uktam
translated: By this, non-attachment, which is called mastery, is stated.

original: ataeva sarvatrātmadṛṣṭyā hiṃsākāraṇadveṣarahitatvāt sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ abhayaṃ
analyzed: ataeva sarvatra ātma dṛṣṭyā hiṃsā kāraṇa dveṣa rahita tvāt sarva bhūta hite ratāḥ abhayam
translated: For this very reason, being free from aversion, which is the cause of injury due to the view of self everywhere, they are engaged in the welfare of all beings, having given fearlessness

original: sarvabhūtebhyo mattaḥ svahā iti mantreṇa dattasarvabhūtābhayadakṣiṇāḥ kṛtasaṃnyāsā
analyzed: sarva bhūtebhyaḥ mattaḥ svahā iti mantreṇa datta sarva bhūta abhaya dakṣiṇāḥ kṛta saṃnyāsā
translated: to all beings with the mantra May all beings be free from fear from me, they have performed renunciation,

original: iti yāvat abhayaṃ sarvabhūtebhyo dattvā saṃnyāsam ācaret iti smṛteḥ /
analyzed: iti yāvat abhayam sarva bhūtebhyaḥ dattvā saṃnyāsam ācaret iti smṛteḥ
translated: that is, up to this point. Having given fearlessness to all beings, one should practice renunciation, according to smrti.

original: evaṃvidhāḥ sarvasādhanasampannāḥ santaḥ svayaṃ brahmabhūtā nirvicikitsena sākṣātkāreṇa sarvasādhanaphalabhūtena mām akṣaraṃ brahmaiva
analyzed: evaṃvidhāḥ sarva sādhana sampannāḥ santaḥ svayam brahma bhūtāḥ nirvicikitsena sākṣātkāreṇa sarva sādhana phala bhūtena mām akṣaram brahma eva
translated: Those who are endowed with all such means, having become Brahman themselves, by means of the direct realization free from doubt, which is the fruit of all means, they attain me alone, the imperishable Brahman,

original: te prāpnuvanti
analyzed: te prāpnuvanti
translated: they attain that.

original: pūrvam api madrūpā eva santo 'vidyānivṛttyā madrūpā eva tiṣṭhantīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvam api mad rūpāḥ eva santaḥ vidyā nivṛttyā mad rūpāḥ eva tiṣṭhanti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they were also of My nature in the past, and by the cessation of ignorance they remain of My nature.

original: brahmaiva san brahmāpy eti /
analyzed: brahma eva san brahma api eti
translated: One who is Brahman alone goes to Brahman.

original: brahma veda brahmaiva bhavati ityādiśrutibhyaḥ /
analyzed: brahma veda brahmā eva bhavati ityādi śrutibhyaḥ
translated: This is stated in the Upanisadic texts such as One who knows Brahman becomes Brahman itself.

original: ihāpi ca jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam Gītā / ity uktam ////
analyzed: iha api ca jñānī tu ātmā eva me matam gītāḥ iti uktam
translated: And in this very Gita it is said: But the knower of the Self is considered by Me to be the very Self.

original: viśvanāthaḥ madīyanirviśeṣabrahmasvarūpopāsakās tu duḥkhitatvāt tato nyūnā ity āha ye tv iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: tu
translated: Visvanatha: But those who meditate on My form as Brahman without distinctions are inferior to that, because they are miserable. He says this with two verses.

original: akṣaraṃ brahma anirdeśyaśabdena vyapadeṣṭum aśakyam /
analyzed: akṣaram brahma anirdeśya śabdena vyapadeṣṭum aśakyam
translated: The Immutable is Brahman, which cannot be indicated by an indescribable word.

original: yato 'vyaktaṃ rūpādihīnam /
analyzed: yatas vyaktam rūpa ādi hīnam
translated: Because it is unmanifest, devoid of form etc.

original: sarvatragaṃ sarvadeśavyāpi /
analyzed: sarvatragam sarva deśa vyāpi
translated: It is all-pervading, pervading all places.

original: acintyaṃ tarkāgamyam /
analyzed: acintyam tarka agamyam
translated: It is inconceivable, not to be reached by reasoning.

original: kūṭasthaṃ sarvakālavyāpi /
analyzed: kūṭastham sarva kāla vyāpi
translated: It is the unchanging, pervading all times.

original: ekarūpatayā tu yaḥ kālavyāpi sa kūṭasthaḥ ity amaraḥ /
analyzed: eka rūpa tayā tu yaḥ kāla vyāpi sa kūṭasthaḥ iti amaraḥ
translated: But one who pervades time with a single form is unchanging, according to Amarakosa.

original: acalaṃ vṛddhyādirahitam /
analyzed: acalam vṛddhi ādi rahitam
translated: It is immovable, devoid of increase etc.

original: dhruvaṃ nityam /
analyzed: dhruvam nityam
translated: It is eternal, permanent.

original: mām evety akṣarasya tasya matto bhedābhāvāt ////
analyzed: mām eva iti akṣarasya tasya mattaḥ bheda abhāvāt
translated: Me alone because that Immutable is not different from Me.

original: baladevaḥ ye tu svasākṣātkṛtipūrvikāṃ madupāsanāṃ na kurvanti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ ye tu sva sākṣātkṛti pūrvikām mad upāsanām na kurvanti
translated: Baladeva: But those who do not perform meditation on Me preceded by direct perception,

original: teṣām api matprāptiḥ syād eva kintv atikleśenāticireṇaivāntas tebhyo 'pakṛṣṭās ta ity āha ye tv iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: teṣām api mad prāptiḥ syāt eva kintu ati kleśena ati cireṇa eva antar tebhyaḥ pakṛṣṭāḥ te iti āha ye tu iti tribhiḥ
translated: For them also there would be attainment of Me, but only with great difficulty and after a very long time. They are inferior to those. He says this with three verses, beginning with But those who...

original: ye tv akṣarasvātmacaitanyam eva pūrvam upāsate /
analyzed: ye tu akṣara sva ātma caitanyam eva pūrvam upāsate
translated: But those who previously worship only the imperishable, which is the self-consciousness,

original: teṣām adhikataraḥ kleśa iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām adhikataraḥ kleśaḥ iti sambandhaḥ
translated: for them there is a still greater difficulty. This is the connection.

original: akṣaraṃ viśinaṣṭi anirdeśyaṃ dehād bhinnatvena dehābhidhāyibhir devamānavādiśabdair nirdeṣṭum aśakyam /
analyzed: akṣaram viśinaṣṭi anirdeśyam dehāt bhinna tvena deha abhidhāyibhiḥ deva mānava ādi śabdaiḥ nirdeṣṭum aśakyam
translated: He distinguishes the imperishable: indescribable, incapable of being described by words like god, man, etc., which denote the body, as different from the body.

original: avyaktaṃ cakṣurādyagocaraṃ pratyak sarvatragaṃ dehendriyaprāṇavyāpi /
analyzed: avyaktam cakṣuḥ ādi agocaram pratyak sarvatragam deha indriya prāṇa vyāpi
translated: Unmanifest, not the object of the eye etc., all-pervading, pervading the body, senses and life-breath.

original: acintyaṃ tarkāgamyaṃ śrutimātravedyam jñānasvarūpam eva jñātṛsvarūpam acalaṃ jñānatvād api calanarahitam /
analyzed: acintyam tarka agamyam śruti mātra vedyam jñāna svarūpam eva jñātṛ svarūpam acalam jñāna tvāt api calana rahitam
translated: Inconceivable, not to be reasoned about, known only through the scriptures, knowledge-form itself, the form of the knower, immovable, devoid of movement even by the nature of being knowledge.

original: dhruvaṃ paramātmaikaśeṣatāyāṃ sarvadā sthiram /
analyzed: dhruvam paramātma eka śeṣa tāyām sarvadā sthiram
translated: Firm, always stable in being the sole remainder of the supreme self.

original: akṣaropāsane vidhim āha saṃniyamyeti /
analyzed: akṣara upāsane vidhim āha saṃniyamya iti
translated: He states the injunction for the worship of the imperishable: Having restrained etc.

original: karaṇagrāmaṃ śrotrādīndriyavṛndaṃ saṃniyamya śabdādisaṃcārebhyas tadvyāpārebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya
analyzed: karaṇa grāmam śrotra ādi indriya vṛndam saṃniyamya śabda ādi saṃcārebhyaḥ tad vyāpārebhyaḥ pratyāhṛtya
translated: Having withdrawn the group of senses, the collection of ears etc., from the activities of conveying sound etc.,

original: sarvatra suhṛnmitrāryudāsīnādiṣu samabuddhayas tulyadṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra suhṛd mitra ari udāsīna ādiṣu sama buddhayaḥ tulya dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: They are of equal mind, of equal vision, towards all, towards friends, foes, neutrals, superiors, inferiors, etc.

original: yad vā / sarveṣu cetanācetaneṣu vastuṣu sthite same brahmaṇi buddhir yeṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ
analyzed: yat vā sarveṣu cetana acetaneṣu vastuṣu sthite same brahmaṇi buddhiḥ yeṣām bhūtānām
translated: Or, they are those beings whose intellect is fixed on Brahman, which is the same in all things, animate and inanimate.

original: hite upakāre ratāḥ sarveṣāṃ śaṃ bhūyād iti yathāyathaṃ yatamānāḥ evaṃ svātmasākṣātkṛtipūrvikāyāṃ🔽madbhaktau madarpitakarmalakṣaṇāyāṃ ye pravartante /
analyzed: hite upakāre ratāḥ sarveṣām śam bhūyāt iti yathāyatham yatamānāḥ evam sva ātma sākṣātkṛti pūrvikāyām  mad bhaktau mad arpita karma lakṣaṇāyām ye pravartante
translated: They are engaged in the welfare, in the help, of all. May all be well. Striving as best they can, thus, in the devotion to Me, which is preceded by the realization of one's own Self, which consists in the offering of actions to Me,

original: te 'pi mām eva pāramaiśvaryapradhānaṃ prāpunuvantīti nāsti saṃśayaḥ ////
analyzed: te pi mām eva pāramaiśvarya pradhānam prāpunuvanti iti na asti saṃśayaḥ
translated: those who engage in it, they also attain Me alone, who am the Supreme Lord, there is no doubt about it.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavadgita

original: kleśo 'dhikataras teṣām avyaktāsaktacetasām /
analyzed: kleśaḥ dhikataraḥ teṣām avyakta āsakta cetasām
translated: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, there is greater affliction.

original: avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṃ dehavadbhir avāpyate ////
analyzed: avyaktā hi gatiḥ duḥkham dehavadbhiḥ avāpyate
translated: For the attainment of the unmanifest goal is difficult for those who have bodies.

original: śrīdharaḥ nanu ca te 'pi cet tvām eva prāpnuvanti tarhītareṣāṃ yuktatamatvaṃ kuta ity apekṣāyāṃ kleśākleśakṛtaṃ viśeṣam āha kleśa iti tribhiḥ
translated: Sridhar: Now, if they also attain You alone, then why is it that the others are the most fit? In anticipation of this question, He speaks of the difference in terms of affliction and non-affliction with three verses.

original: avyakte nirviśeṣe 'kṣara āsaktaṃ ceto yeṣāṃ teṣāṃ kleśo 'dhikataraḥ /
analyzed: avyakte nirviśeṣe kṣare āsaktam cetaḥ yeṣām teṣām kleśaḥ dhikataraḥ
translated: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, the imperishable Brahman, there is greater affliction.

original: hi yasmād avyaktaviṣayā gatir niṣṭhā dehābhimānibhir duḥkhaṃ yathā bhavaty evam avāpyate /
analyzed: hi yasmāt avyakta viṣayā gatiḥ niṣṭhā deha abhimānibhiḥ duḥkham yathā bhavati evam avāpyate
translated: Hi, since; the attainment of the Unmanifest is difficult, as it is for those who are identified with the body.

original: dehābhimānināṃ nityaṃ pratyakpravaṇatvasya durghaṭatvād iti ////
analyzed: deha abhimāninām nityam pratyak pravaṇa tvasya durghaṭa tvāt iti
translated: For those who are identified with the body, the state of being constantly inclined towards the inner self is difficult to achieve.

original: madhusūdanaḥ idānīm etebhyaḥ pūrveṣām atiśayaṃ darśayann āha kleśa iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ idānīm etebhyaḥ pūrveṣām atiśayam darśayan āha kleśaḥ iti
translated: Madhusudana now shows the superiority of these [yogis] over the previous ones, saying 'kleśa' [means] difficulty.

original: pūrveṣām api viṣayebhya āhṛtya saguṇe manaāveśe satataṃ tatkarmaparāyaṇatve ca paraśraddhopetatve ca kleśo 'dhiko bhavaty eva /
analyzed: pūrveṣām api viṣayebhyaḥ āhṛtya saguṇe manaḥ āveśe satatam tad karma parāyaṇa tve ca para śraddhā upeta tve ca kleśaḥ dhikaḥ bhavati eva
translated: Even for the previous [yogis], there is certainly more difficulty in withdrawing the mind from the objects and concentrating it on the qualities, and in being devoted to the actions [prescribed by the Vedas] and possessing faith in others.

original: kintu avyaktāsaktacetasāṃ nirguṇabrahmacintanaparāṇāṃ teṣāṃ pūrvoktasādhanavatāṃ kleśa āyāso 'dhikataro 'tiśayenādhikaḥ /
analyzed: kintu avyakta āsakta cetasām nirguṇa brahma cintana parāṇām teṣām pūrva ukta sādhanavatām kleśaḥ āyāsaḥ dhikataraḥ atiśayena adhikaḥ
translated: But for those whose minds are attached to the Unmanifest, who are devoted to the meditation on qualityless Brahman, who possess the aforementioned means, the difficulty, the exertion, is more, is exceedingly more.

original: atra svayam eva hetum āha bhagavān avyaktā hi gatiḥ /
analyzed: atra svayam eva hetum āha bhagavān avyaktā hi gatiḥ
translated: Here the Lord Himself states the reason: 'The attainment of the Unmanifest is difficult.'

original: hi yasmād akṣarātmakaṃ gantavyaṃ phalabhūtaṃ brahma duḥkhaṃ yathā syāt tathā kṛcchreṇa dehavadbhir dehamānibhir avāpyate /
analyzed: hi yasmāt akṣara ātmakam gantavyam phala bhūtam brahma duḥkham yathā syāt tathā kṛcchreṇa dehavadbhiḥ deha mānibhiḥ avāpyate
translated: Hi, since; the attainment of Brahman, which is the goal in the form of the Immutable, is difficult, as it is for those who have bodies. It is attained with difficulty by those who are identified with the body.

original: sarvakarmasaṃnyāsaṃ kṛtvā gurum upasṛtya vedāntavākyānāṃ tena tena vicāreṇa tattadbhramanirākaraṇe mahān prayāsaḥ /
analyzed: sarva karma saṃnyāsam kṛtvā gurum upasṛtya vedānta vākyānām tena tena vicāreṇa tad tad bhrama nirākaraṇe mahān prayāsaḥ
translated: Having renounced all actions, having approached the teacher, the great effort in the removal of those and those delusions by that and that consideration of the Vedanta statements.

original: pratyakṣasiddhas tataḥ kleśo 'dhikataras teṣām ity uktam /
analyzed: pratyakṣa siddhaḥ tatas kleśaḥ dhikataraḥ teṣām iti uktam
translated: It has been said that their pain is greater than that which is directly perceived.

original: yadyapy ekam eva phalaṃ tathāpi ye duṣkareṇopāyena prāpnuvanto bhavanti śreṣṭhā ity abhiprāyaḥ ////
analyzed: yadi api ekam eva phalam tathā api ye duṣkareṇa upāyena prāpnuvantaḥ bhavanti śreṣṭhāḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Although the fruit is one and the same, the intention is that those who attain it by a difficult means become the best.

original: viśvanāthaḥ tarhi kenāṃśena teṣām apakarṣas tatrāha kleśa iti /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ tarhi kena aṃśena teṣām apakarṣaḥ tatra āha kleśaḥ iti
translated: Viśvanātha: Then by what part is their inferiority? There it is said that pain, etc.

original: na kenāpi vyajyata ity avyaktaṃ brahma tatraivāsaktacetasāṃ tad evānububhūṣūṇāṃ teṣāṃ tatprāntau kleśo 'dhikataraḥ /
analyzed: na kena api vyajyate iti avyaktam brahma tatra eva āsakta cetasām tat eva anububhūṣūṇām teṣām tad prāntau kleśaḥ dhikataraḥ
translated: The unmanifest Brahman is not manifested by anyone. For those whose minds are attached to that alone, who desire to experience that alone, their pain is greater at the end of that.

original: hi yasmād avyaktā gatiḥ kenāpi prakāreṇa vyaktībhavatisā gatir dehavadbhir jīvair duḥkhaṃ yathā bhavaty evam avāpyate /
analyzed: hi yasmāt avyaktā gatiḥ kena api prakāreṇa vyaktībhavati sā gatiḥ dehavadbhiḥ jīvaiḥ duḥkham yathā bhavati evam avāpyate
translated: For, the unmanifest goal is manifested by some means. That goal is attained by embodied beings with difficulty, just as it happens.

original: tathā hīndriyāṇāṃ śabdādijñānaviśeṣa eva śaktiḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi indriyāṇām śabda ādi jñāna viśeṣaḥ eva śaktiḥ
translated: For example, the sense organs have the power only to know sound and other objects in particular.

original: na tu viśeṣatarajñānam iti /
analyzed: na tu viśeṣatara jñānam iti
translated: But not the knowledge of a higher degree.

original: ata indriyanirodhas teṣāṃ nirviśeṣajñānam icchatām avaśyakartavya eva /
analyzed: atas indriya nirodhaḥ teṣām nirviśeṣa jñānam icchatām avaśya kartavyaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, for those who desire to attain the knowledge of the non-distinction of the Self, the restraint of the senses is absolutely necessary.

original: indriyāṇāṃ nirodhas tu srotasvatīnām iva srotonirodho duṣkara eva /
analyzed: indriyāṇām nirodhaḥ tu srotasvatīnām iva srotaḥ nirodhaḥ duṣkaraḥ eva
translated: But the restraint of the senses is as difficult as the restraint of the current of a river.

original: yad uktaṃ sanatkumāreṇa 🔽yatpādapaṅkajapalāśavilāsabhaktyā
analyzed: yat uktam sanatkumāreṇa  yat pāda paṅkaja palāśa vilāsa bhaktyā
translated: As Sanatkumara said:

original: karmāśayaṃ grathitam udgrathayanti santaḥ /
analyzed: karma āśayam grathitam udgrathayanti santaḥ
translated: By the devotion to the graceful lotus feet of which [Lord Vāsudeva], the saints untie the knot of the latent impressions of karma,

original: tadvan na riktamatayo yatayo /pi ruddha
analyzed: tadvat na rikta matayaḥ yatayaḥ pi
translated: In the same way, O Uddhava, those whose minds are not empty, even though they are restrained,

original: srotogaṇās tam araṇaṃ bhaja vāsudevam // BhP / /
analyzed: srotaḥ gaṇāḥ tam araṇam bhaja vāsudevam
translated: Worship that Supreme Lord Vāsudeva, whose current of senses is stopped.

original: kleśo mahān iha bhavārṇavam aplaveśāṃ
analyzed: kleśaḥ mahān iha bhava arṇavam a plava īśām
translated: The great hardship of those who do not swim in this ocean of worldly existence,

original: ṣaḍvarganakram asukhena titīrṣanti /
analyzed: ṣaḍvarga nakram asukhena titīrṣanti
translated: Who with difficulty cross the crocodile of the six sense objects,

original: tat tvaṃ harer bhagavato bhajanīyam aṅghriṃ
analyzed: tat tvam hareḥ bhagavataḥ bhajanīyam aṅghrim
translated: You, O Uddhava, make the foot of the Lord Hari, who is to be worshipped,

original: kṛtvoḍupaṃ vyasanam uttara dustarārṇam // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: kṛtvā uḍupam vyasanam iti
translated: Your raft to cross the difficult-to-cross ocean of worldly existence.

original: tāvatā kleśenāpi sā gatir yadyapy avāpyate /
analyzed: tāvatā kleśena api sā gatiḥ yadi api avāpyate
translated: Even if that goal is attained by that much hardship,

original: tad api bhaktimiśreṇaiva /
analyzed: tat api bhakti miśreṇa eva
translated: It is attained only by one who is mixed with devotion.

original: bhagavati bhaktiṃ vinā kevalabrahmopāsakānāṃ tu kevalakleśa eva lābho na tu brahmaprāptiḥ /
analyzed: bhagavati bhaktim vinā kevala brahma upāsakānām tu kevala kleśaḥ eva lābhaḥ na tu brahma prāptiḥ
translated: But for those who meditate on Brahman alone without devotion to the Lord, there is only hardship, not the attainment of Brahman.

original: yad uktaṃ brahmaṇā
analyzed: yat uktam brahmaṇā
translated: As Brahmā said:

original: teṣām asau kleśala eva śiṣyate

translated: For them, that alone remains as the affliction,🔽nothing else, just as for those who thresh the gross husk.

analyzed: hi yasmāt avyaktā gatiḥ avyaktā akṣara viṣayā manaḥ vṛttiḥ dehavadbhiḥ deha abhimānibhiḥ janaiḥ duḥkham yathā syāt tathā avāpyate

original: dehavantaḥ khalu sthūladeham eva sucirād ātmatvenānuśīlitavantaḥ katham aṇucaitanyaṃ sucirojjhitavimarśam ātmatvenānuśīlituṃ prabhaveyur
analyzed: dehavantaḥ khalu sthūla deham eva su cirāt ātma tvena anuśīlitavantaḥ katham aṇu caitanyam su cira ujjhita vimarśam ātma tvena anuśīlitum prabhaveyuḥ  /
translated: For those who have bodies, having long considered only the gross body as the self, how could they be able to consider the atomic consciousness, which has long been abandoned in thought, as the self?

original: iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

original: yat tv atra vyācakṣate /
analyzed: yat tu atra vyācakṣate
translated: But what they explain here:

original: saguṇaṃ nirguṇaṃ ceti dvirūpaṃ brahma /🔽tatra saguṇopāsanam ākāravadviṣayatvāt sukaram apramādaṃ ca /
analyzed: sa guṇam nirguṇam ca iti dvi rūpam brahma  tatra sa guṇa upāsanam ākāravat viṣaya tvāt sukaram apramādam ca
translated: Brahman has two forms: with qualities and without qualities.🔽Among them, meditation with qualities is easy and free from negligence because it has an object with form.

original: nirguṇopāsanaṃ tu tattvābhāvād duḥkhakaraṃ sapramādaṃ ca /
analyzed: nirguṇa upāsanam tu tattva abhāvāt duḥkha karam sa pramādam ca
translated: But meditation without qualities is difficult to perform and with negligence because it lacks reality.

original: tac ca nirguṇaṃ brahmākṣaraśabdenocyate /
analyzed: tat ca nirguṇam brahma akṣara śabdena ucyate
translated: And that Brahman without qualities is called the syllable akṣara.

original: nairguṇyapratipattaye sapta viśeṣaṇāni anirdeśyaṃ vedāgocaraṃ /
analyzed: nairguṇya pratipattaye sapta viśeṣaṇāni anirdeśyam veda agocaram
translated: For the realization of qualitylessness, there are seven qualifications: indescribable, beyond the range of the Vedas,

original: yato 'vyaktaṃ jātyādiśūnyam /
analyzed: yatas vyaktam jāti ādi śūnyam
translated: because it is unmanifest, devoid of genus etc.

original: sarvatragaṃ vyāpi /
analyzed: sarvatragam vyāpi
translated: Pervading everywhere, all-pervading.

original: acintyaṃ manasāpy agamyam /
analyzed: a cintyam manasā api a gamyam
translated: Inconceivable, not even accessible to the mind.

original: śrutiś ca yato vāco nivartante aprāpya manasā saha TaittU / / ity ādyā /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca yatas vācaḥ nivartante a prāpya manasā saha iti ādyā
translated: And the scripture says: From which words turn back, unable to reach it, along with the mind. (Tai. 2.1) etc.

original: kūṭasthaṃ mithābhūtam api satyavat pratītaṃ jagat kūṭam ucyate /
analyzed: kūṭastham mithā bhūtam api satya vat pratītam jagat kūṭam ucyate
translated: The unchanging, although falsely existent, the world which appears as if true is called a kuṭa.

original: yathā kūtakārṣāpaṇādi /
analyzed: yathā kūta kārṣāpaṇa ādi
translated: Like a kuṭa coin etc.

original: tasminn ādhyāsikasambandhenādhiṣṭhānatayā sthitam /
analyzed: tasmin ādhyāsika sambandhena adhiṣṭhāna tayā sthitam
translated: It is situated as the substratum in that superimposition relation.

original: acaram avikāram ato dhruvaṃ nityam iti /
analyzed: acaram avikāram atas dhruvam nityam iti
translated: It is unmoving, unchanging, therefore eternal, permanent.

original: tadvidāṃ khalu gurūpasattipūrvakopaniṣadvicāratadarthamananatannididhyāsanair mahān kleśaḥ /
analyzed: tad vidām khalu guru upasatti pūrvaka upaniṣad vicāra tad artha manana tad nididhyāsanaiḥ mahān kleśaḥ
translated: For those who know that, there is great hardship through the inquiry into the Upanishads preceded by the service of a teacher, the reflection on its meaning, and the meditation on it.

original: pūrveṣāṃ tu tair vinaiva gurūktabhagavatprasādāvirbhūtenājñānatatkāryavimardinā
analyzed: pūrveṣām tu taiḥ vinā eva guru ukta bhagavat prasāda āvirbhūtena ajñāna tad kārya vimardinā
translated: But for the former, by that alone, without a teacher, through knowledge that manifests by the grace of God, which crushes ignorance and its effects,

original: vijñānena bhagavatsvarūpabhūtanirguṇākṣarātmaikyalakṣaṇā muktir iti phalaikye
analyzed: iti
translated: there is liberation characterized by the identity with the attributeless imperishable Brahman, which is the nature of God. Thus, even though the fruit is the same,

original: 'pi kleśākleśābhyām apakarṣotkarṣāv iti /
analyzed: pi kleśa akleśābhyām apakarṣa utkarṣau iti
translated: there is inferiority and superiority due to hardship and lack of hardship.

original: tad idaṃ mandaṃ gatisāmānyāt iti sūtre brahmaṇo dvairūpyanirāsāt /
analyzed: tat idam mandam gati sāmānyāt iti sūtre brahmaṇaḥ dvairūpya nirāsāt
translated: This is weak, because in the sutra due to the commonality of the path, the duality of Brahman is refuted.

original: yathā tad akṣaram adhigamyate iti tasya vedavedyatvaśravaṇāt /
analyzed: yathā tat akṣaram adhigamyate iti tasya veda vedya tva śravaṇāt
translated: Because it is heard that how is that imperishable one to be attained? it is to be known through the Vedas.

original: yato vācaḥ ity āde kārtsnyāgocaratvārthatvāt /
analyzed: yatas vācaḥ iti āde kārtsnya agocara tva artha tvāt
translated: Because in passages like from which speech turns away, etc., it means not being the object of the whole.

original: pravṛttinimittābhāvena nirguṇasyāpramāṇatvāt taucchyāc ca lakṣyatvaṃ tu na /
analyzed: pravṛtti nimitta abhāvena nirguṇasya apramāṇa tvāt taucchyāt ca lakṣya tvam tu na
translated: Because the attributeless is not a means of knowledge due to the absence of the reason for activity, and because it is insignificant, it is not the object of definition.

original: sarvaśabdavācyatvasvīkārāt /
translated: Because the existence of everything that is denoted by words is accepted.

original: sadaikāvasthasya vastunaḥ kūṭasthatvenābhidhānān na ca jagat kūṭam /
analyzed: sadā eka avasthasya vastunaḥ kūṭastha tvena abhidhānāt na ca jagat kūṭam
translated: And the world is not a mere illusion, because a real entity is always in one state only, and is spoken of as immutable.

original: kavir manīṣī paribhūḥ svayambhur
analyzed: kaviḥ manīṣī paribhūḥ svayambhuḥ
translated: The wise, the intelligent, the lord, the self-existent one,

original: yāthātathyato 'rthān vyadadhāc chāśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ Īśopaniṣad
analyzed: yāthātathyataḥ rthān vyadadhāt śāśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ īśa upaniṣad
translated: has established the truths for all time, from the Isha Upanishad.

original: ity ādau tasya satyatvaśravaṇāt /
analyzed: iti ādau tasya satya tva śravaṇāt
translated: Thus, because of hearing about its truth in the beginning.

original: yaśodāstanandhayavibhucidvigrahasya parabrahmatvaśravaṇena tadantasthanirguṇākṣarakalpanasya śraddhājāḍyakṛtatvāt ////
translated: And because of hearing about the supreme Brahman being the body of consciousness of the lord who sucks on Yashoda's breast, the conception of the attributeless Akshara within it is due to the dullness of faith.

original: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya matparāḥ /
analyzed: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya mad parāḥ
translated: But those who, dedicating all actions to Me, are devoted to Me,

original: ananyenaiva yogena māṃ dhyāyanta upāsate ////🔽teṣām ahaṃ samuddhartā mṛtyusaṃsārasāgarāt /
analyzed: an anyena eva yogena mām dhyāyantaḥ upāsate  teṣām aham samuddhartā mṛtyu saṃsāra sāgarāt
translated: meditating on Me with single-pointed concentration, worship Me.

original: bhavāmi na cirāt pārtha mayy āveśitacetasām ////
analyzed: bhavāmi na cirāt pārtha mayi āveśita cetasām
translated: I become the deliverer from the ocean of worldly existence and death of those whose minds are fixed on Me, O Partha, in no time at all.

original: śrīdharaḥ madbhaktānāṃ tu matprasādād anāyāsenaiva siddhir bhavatīty āha ye tv iti dvābhyām /
translated: The two verses beginning with ye tu (those who) state that for My devotees, perfection comes without effort by My grace.

original: ye mayi parameśvare sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasya samarpya matparā bhūtvā /
analyzed: ye mayi parameśvare sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasya samarpya mad parāḥ bhūtvā
translated: Those who, dedicating all actions to Me, the Supreme Lord, and becoming devoted to Me,

original: māṃ dhyāyantaḥ /
analyzed: mām dhyāyantaḥ
translated: meditating on Me,

original: ananyena na vidyate 'nyo bhajanīyo yasmiṃs tenaiva /
analyzed: an anyena na vidyate nyaḥ bhajanīyaḥ yasmin tena eva
translated: By which (means) there is no other worshipper except by that (means) alone.

original: ekāntabhaktiyogenopāsata ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: ekānta bhakti yogena upāsate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they worship by the yoga of exclusive devotion.

original: teṣām iti / evaṃ mayy āveśitaṃ ceto yais teṣām /
analyzed: teṣām iti evam mayi āveśitam cetaḥ yaiḥ teṣām
translated: 'Of them' - of those who have thus fixed their mind on Me.

original: mṛtyuyuktāt saṃsārasāgarād ahaṃ samyag uddhartācireṇa bhavāmi ////
analyzed: mṛtyu yuktāt saṃsāra sāgarāt aham samyak uddhartā acireṇa bhavāmi
translated: I am the true deliverer from the ocean of worldly existence, which is full of death, in a short time.

original: madhusūdanaḥ nanu phalaikye kleśālpatvādhikyābhyāsam utkarṣanikarṣau syātāṃ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ nanu phala aikye kleśa alpatva ādhikya abhyāsam utkarṣa nikarṣau syātām
translated: Madhusudana: Now, if there is oneness of result, then superiority and inferiority would be due to the lesser and greater difficulty.

original: tad eva tu nāsti nirguṇabrahmavidāṃ hi phalam avidyātatkāryanivṛttyā nirviśeṣaparamānandabodhabrahmarūpatā /
analyzed: tat eva tu nā asti nirguṇa brahma vidām hi phalam avidyā tad kārya nivṛttyā nirviśeṣa paramānanda bodha brahma rūpa tā
translated: But that itself is not so. For the knowers of Brahman without qualities, the result is the state of Brahman, which is pure consciousness and absolute bliss, free from ignorance and its effects.

original: saguṇabrahmavidāṃ tv adhiṣṭhānapramāyā abhāvenāvidyānivṛttyabhāvād aiśvaryaviśeṣaḥ kāryabrahmalokagatānāṃ phalam /
analyzed: saguṇa brahma vidām tu adhiṣṭhāna pramāyāḥ abhāvena avidyā nivṛtti abhāvāt aiśvarya viśeṣaḥ kārya brahma loka gatānām phalam
translated: But for the knowers of Brahman with qualities, the result is the attainment of special lordship for those who have gone to the world of Brahman, because there is no cessation of ignorance due to the absence of the knowledge of the substratum.

original: ataḥ phalādhikyārtham āyāsādhikyaṃ na nyūnatām āpādayatīit cet /
analyzed: atas phala ādhikya artham āyāsa ādhikyam na nyūna tām āpādayati ced
translated: Therefore, if the greater effort for the sake of the greater result does not lead to inferiority,

original: na suguṇopāsanayā nirastasarvapratibandhānāṃ vinā gurūpadeśaṃ vinā ca śravaṇamanananididhyāsanādyāvṛttikleśaṃ
analyzed: na suguṇa upāsanayā nirasta sarva pratibandhānām vinā guru upadeśam vinā ca śravaṇa manana nididhyāsana ādi āvṛtti kleśam
translated: then no. For those whose all obstacles are removed by the meditation on the qualified Brahman, without the instruction of a teacher, and without the effort of listening, reflection, and meditation, etc.,

original: svayam āvirbhūtena vedāntavākyeneśvaraprasādasahakṛtena tattvajñānodayād avidyātatkāryanivṛttyā
analyzed: svayam āvirbhūtena vedānta vākyena īśvara prasāda sahakṛtena tattva jñāna udayāt avidyā tad kārya nivṛttyā
translated: Because, by the Upaniṣad-texts which have manifested themselves by themselves, in conjunction with the grace of God, the knowledge of truth arises, and by the cessation of Nescience and its effects,

original: brahmaloka evaiśvaryabhogānte nirguṇabrahmavidyāphalaparamakaivalyopapatteḥ /🔽sa etasmāj jīvaghanāt parātparaṃ puriśayaṃ puruṣam🔽īkṣate iti śruteḥ sa prāptahiraṇyagarbhaiśvaryo bhogānta etasmāj jīvaghanāt sarvajīvasamaṣṭirūpāt
analyzed: brahma loke eva aiśvarya bhoga ante nirguṇa brahma vidyā phala parama kaivalya upapatteḥ  saḥ etasmāt jīva ghanāt parātparam puriśayam puruṣam  īkṣate iti śruteḥ sa prāpta hiraṇyagarbha aiśvaryaḥ bhoga ante etasmāt jīva ghanāt sarva jīva samaṣṭi rūpāt
translated: the attainment of the highest isolation, which is the fruit of the knowledge of the Brahman without attributes, takes place at the end of the enjoyment of sovereignty in the world of Brahman itself.🔽He sees that Supreme Person, the Inner Soul, who is higher than this mass of beings, (Kaṭha. 1.3.9) according to this Vedic text. He, having attained the sovereignty of Hiraṇyagarbha, at the end of enjoyment, sees that Supreme Person, the Supreme Self, who is full, non-different from the inner self, and without a second, who is the Inner Soul, who is different and superior to this mass of beings, which is of the form of the totality of all beings,

original: parāc chreṣṭhād dhiraṇyagarbhāt paraṃ vilakṣaṇaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ ca puriśayaṃ svahṛdayaguhāniviṣṭaṃ
analyzed: parāt śreṣṭhāt hiraṇyagarbhāt param vilakṣaṇam śreṣṭham ca puriśayam sva hṛdaya guhā niviṣṭam
translated: who is higher, superior, than Hiraṇyagarbha.🔽By means of the Upaniṣad-texts which have manifested themselves by themselves, he realizes, he makes manifest,

original: puruṣaṃ pūrṇaṃ pratyagabhinnam advitīyaṃ paramātmānam īkṣate svayam āvirbhūtena🔽vedāntapramāṇena sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: puruṣam pūrṇam pratyak abhinnam advitīyam paramātmānam īkṣate svayam āvirbhūtena  vedānta pramāṇena sākṣātkaroti
translated: that Supreme Self.

original: tāvatā ca mukto bhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: tāvatā ca muktaḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: And by that much, he becomes liberated. This is the meaning.

original: tathā ca vināpi prāguktakleśena saguṇabrahmavidām īśvaraprasādena nirguṇabrahmavidyāphalaprāptir itīmam artham āha ye tv iti dvyābhyām
analyzed: tathā ca vinā api prāc ukta kleśena saguṇa brahma vidām īśvara prasādena nirguṇa brahmavidyā phala prāptiḥ iti imam artham āha ye tu iti dvyābhyām
translated: And thus, even without the previously mentioned affliction, the attainment of the fruit of the knowledge of the Brahman without attributes is by the grace of God for those who have the knowledge of the Brahman with attributes. This meaning is stated by the two verses beginning with But those who...

original: tuśabda uktāśaṅkānivṛttyarthaḥ /
analyzed: tuśabdaḥ ukta āśaṅkā nivṛtti arthaḥ
translated: The word 'tu' (but) is for the purpose of removing the doubt expressed.

original: ye sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya saguṇe vāsudeve samarpya matparā ahaṃ bhagavān🔽vāsudeva eva paraḥ prakṛṣṭaḥ prītiviṣayo yeṣāṃ te tathā santo 'nanyenaiva yogena
analyzed: ye sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya saguṇe vāsudeve samarpya mad parāḥ aham bhagavān  vāsudevaḥ eva paraḥ prakṛṣṭaḥ prīti viṣayaḥ yeṣām te tathā santaḥ yogena
translated: Those who, having dedicated all actions to Me, to the qualified Vasudeva, and making Me their supreme goal,🔽those who are such, with undivided devotion alone,

original: na vidyate māṃ bhagavantaṃ muktvānyadālambanaṃ yasya tādṛśenaiva yogena samādhinaikāntabhaktiyogāparanāmnā
analyzed: na vidyate mām bhagavantam muktvā anyat ālambanam yasya tādṛśena eva yogena samādhinā ekānta bhakti yoga apara nāmnā
translated: with a yoga that has no other support except Me, the Lord,

original: māṃ bhagavantaṃ vāsudevaṃ sakalasaundaryasāranidhānam ānandaghanavigrahaṃ dvibhujaṃ
analyzed: mām bhagavantam vāsudevam sakala saundarya sāra nidhānam ānanda ghana vigraham dvi bhujam
translated: meditating on Me, the Lord Vasudeva, the abode of the essence of all beauty, with a form full of bliss, with two arms,

original: caturbhujaṃ vā samastajanamanomohinīṃ muralīm antimanoharaiḥ saptabhiḥ svarair
analyzed: catur bhujam vā samasta jana manaḥ mohinīm muralīm anti manoharaiḥ saptabhiḥ svaraiḥ
translated: or with four arms, playing the flute that captivates the minds of all people, filling it with the last seven melodious notes,

original: āpūrayantaṃ vā darakamalakaumodakīrathāṅgasaṅgipāṇipallavaṃ vā narasiṃharāghavādirūpaṃ
analyzed: āpūrayantam vā dara kamala kaumodakī rathāṅga saṅgi pāṇi pallavam vā narasiṃha rāghava ādi rūpam
translated: or with sprouts of hands holding a lotus, a mace, a discus, and a conch, or in the form of Narasimha, Rama, and others,

original: vā yathādarśitaviśvarūpaṃ vā dhyāyanta upāsate samānākāram avicchinnaṃ cittavṛttipravāhaṃ
analyzed: vā yathā darśita viśva rūpam vā dhyāyantaḥ upāsate samāna ākāram avicchinnam cittavṛtti pravāham
translated: or in the form of the universe as revealed, meditating on Me, worshipping Me with an uninterrupted flow of thoughts of the same form,

original: saṃtanvate samīpavartitayā 'sate tisṭhanti vā tesāṃ mayy āveśitacetasāṃ
analyzed: saṃtanvate samīpa varti tayā sate tisṭhanti vā tesām mayi āveśita cetasām
translated: 3.23 They who have fixed their minds on Me, who are ever devoted to Me, I quickly deliver them from the ocean of birth, death and old age.

original: mayi yathokta āveśitam ekāgratayā praveśitaṃ ceto yais teṣām ahaṃ satatopāsito bhagavān
analyzed: mayi yathā ukte āveśitam ekāgra tayā praveśitam cetaḥ yaiḥ teṣām aham satata upāsitaḥ bhagavān
translated: They who have fixed, concentrated, their minds on Me as described above, to them, who are ever devoted to Me, the Lord,

original: mṛtyusaṃsārasāgarām mṛtyuyukto yaḥ saṃsāro mithyājñānatatkāryaprapañcaḥ sa
analyzed: mṛtyu saṃsāra sāgarām mṛtyu yuktaḥ yaḥ saṃsāraḥ mithyājñāna tad kārya prapañcaḥ sa
translated: I, who am the deliverer from the ocean of birth, death and old age, from the ocean of worldly existence which is full of death, which is the false knowledge and the world of its effects,

original: eva sāgarā iva duruttaras tasmāt samuddhartā samyag anāyasenordhve sarvabādhāv adhibhūte🔽śuddhe brahmaṇi dhartā dhārayitā jñānāvaṣṭambhadānena bhavāmi na cirāt kṣipram eva
analyzed: eva sāgarāḥ iva duruttaraḥ tasmāt samuddhartā samyak anāyasena ūrdhve sarva bādhau adhibhūte  śuddhe brahmaṇi dhartā dhārayitā jñāna avaṣṭambha dānena bhavāmi na cirāt kṣipram eva
translated: which is difficult to cross like the ocean, I, who am the deliverer from that, without any effort, upwards, in the Supreme Being who is above all,

original: tasminn eva janmani /
analyzed: tasmin eva janmani
translated: who is pure, I become the supporter by giving the support of knowledge, quickly, in that very life.

original: he pārtheti sambodhanam āśvāsārtham ////
analyzed: he pārtha iti sambodhanam āśvāsa artham
translated: O Partha, the address 'O Partha' is for the purpose of consoling.

original: viśvanāthaḥ bhaktānāṃ tu jñānaṃ vinaiva kevalayā bhaktyaiva sukhena saṃsārān muktir ity āha ye tv iti /
translated: Visvanatha: But for the devotees, liberation from the world is easily obtained by devotion alone, without knowledge. This is what is said by 'Ye tu' etc.

original: mayi yat prānty arthaṃ saṃnyasya tyaktvā saṃnyāsaśabdasya tyāgārthatvāt /
analyzed: mayi yat prānti artham saṃnyasya tyaktvā saṃnyāsa śabdasya tyāga artha tvāt
translated: On Me, having renounced, having given up, for the sake of the end, i.e. for the sake of Liberation. The word 'sannyasa' means giving up.

original: ananyenaiva jñānakarmatapasyādirahitenaiva yogena bhaktiyogena yad uktaṃ yat karmabhir yat tapasā jñānavairāgyataś ca yat BhP / / 🔽ity anantaram /
analyzed: ananyena eva jñāna karma tapasya ādi rahitena eva yogena bhakti yogena yat uktam yat karmabhiḥ yat tapasā jñāna vairāgyataḥ ca yat  iti anantaram
translated: By the yoga of devotion alone, which is devoid of any other means such as knowledge, ritual, austerity, etc., as stated in the following verse:

original: sarvaṃ madbhaktiyogena madbhakto labhate 'ñjasā /
analyzed: sarvam mad bhakti yogena mad bhaktaḥ labhate ñjasā
translated: What is attained through rituals, austerity, knowledge, detachment, and renunciation, all that is easily attained by a devotee through the yoga of devotion to Me.

original: svargāpavargaṃ maddhāma kathañcid yadi vāñchati // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: svarga apavargam mad dhāma kathañcid yadi vāñchati
translated: If a devotee of Mine desires heaven, liberation, or My abode, somehow or other.

original: nanu tad api teṣāṃ saṃsārataraṇe kaḥ prakāra iti cet / satyaṃ /
analyzed: nanu tat api teṣām saṃsāra taraṇe kaḥ prakāraḥ iti ced satyam
translated: But what is the means for them to cross over worldly existence? If it is asked, it is true.

original: teṣāṃ saṃsārataraṇaprakāre jijñāsā naiva jñāyate /
analyzed: teṣām saṃsāra taraṇa prakāre jijñāsā na eva jñāyate
translated: The desire to know the means for them to cross over worldly existence is not known at all.

original: yatas tatprakāraṃ vinaivāham eva tāṃs tārayiṣyāmīty āha teṣām iti /
analyzed: yatas tad prakāram vinā eva aham eva tān tārayiṣyāmi iti āha teṣām iti
translated: Because without that means, I myself will deliver them. Thus He says for them etc.

original: tena bhagavato bhakteṣv eva vātsalyaṃ na tu jñāniṣv iti dhvaniḥ ////
analyzed: tena bhagavataḥ bhakteṣu eva vātsalyam na tu jñāniṣu iti dhvaniḥ
translated: By this, the suggestion is that the Lord has affection only for the devotees, not for the knowers of the Self.

original: baladevaḥ tathātmayāthātmyaṃ śrutvaivātmāṃśino mama kevalāṃ bhaktiṃ ye kurvanti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tathā ātma yāthātmyam śrutvā eva ātma aṃśinaḥ mama kevalām bhaktim ye kurvanti
translated: Balarama: Those who, having heard about the nature of the Self, engage in exclusive devotion to Me, the part of the Self,

original: na tv ātmasākṣātkṛtaye prayatante /
analyzed: na tu ātma sākṣātkṛtaye prayatante
translated: but do not strive to realize the Self.

original: teṣāṃ tu kevalayā madbhaktyaiva matprāptir acireṇaiva syād ity āha ye tv iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: teṣām tu kevalayā mad bhaktyā eva mad prāptiḥ acireṇa eva syāt iti āha ye tu iti dvābhyām
translated: But they will attain Me soon enough, by devotion to Me alone. This is what is being said by the two verses beginning with 'ye tu'.

original: ye madekāntino mayi matprāptyarthaṃ sarvāṇi svavihitāny api karmāṇi saṃnyasya🔽bhaktivikṣepakatvabuddhyā parityajya matparā madekapuruṣārthāḥ santo 'nanyena
analyzed: ye mad ekāntinaḥ mayi mad prāpti artham sarvāṇi sva vihitāni api karmāṇi saṃnyasya  bhakti vikṣepaka tva buddhyā parityajya mad parāḥ mad eka puruṣa arthāḥ santaḥ na anyena
translated: Those who are solely devoted to Me, who, for the sake of attaining Me, renounce all their own prescribed duties,

original: kevalena macchravaṇādilakṣaṇena yogenopāyena māṃ kṛṣṇam upāsate /
analyzed: kevalena mad śravaṇa ādi lakṣaṇena yogena upāyena mām kṛṣṇam upāsate
translated: considering them to be distractions from devotion, who are solely intent on Me, whose only goal is Me, who worship Me, Krsna, with exclusive devotion characterized by listening to Me, etc.,

original: tallakṣaṇāṃ madupāsanāṃ kurvanti dhyāyantaḥ śravaṇādikāle 'pi manniviṣṭamanasaḥ /
analyzed: tad lakṣaṇām mad upāsanām kurvanti dhyāyantaḥ śravaṇa ādi kāle mad niviṣṭa manasaḥ
translated: with a means that is solely that, with a mind fixed on Me even during the time of listening, etc.

original: teṣāṃ mayy āveśitacetasāṃ madekānuraktamanasāṃ bhaktānām aham eva mṛtyuyuktāt saṃsārāt sāgaravad dustarāt samuddhartā bhavāmi /
analyzed: teṣām mayi āveśita cetasām mad eka anurakta manasām bhaktānām aham eva mṛtyu yuktāt saṃsārāt sāgara vat dustarāt samuddhartā bhavāmi
translated: I, the Uddharta, the lifter, lift them, the devotees whose minds are fixed on Me, whose minds are solely attached to Me, from the world that is full of death, from the ocean-like world that is difficult to cross.

original: na cirāt tvarayā tatprāptivilambāsahamānas tān ahaṃ garuḍaskandham āropya svadhāma🔽prāpayāmīty arcirādinirapekṣā teṣāṃ maddhāmaprāptiḥ
analyzed: na cirāt tvarayā tad prāpti vilamba a sahamānaḥ tān aham garuḍa skandham āropya sva dhāma  prāpayāmi iti arciḥ ādi nirapekṣā teṣām mad dhāma prāptiḥ
translated: I, unable to bear the delay in their attainment, quickly take them up on Garuda's back and bring them to My abode.🔽Thus, without depending on the path of light, etc., their attainment of My abode is

original: nayāmi paramaṃ sthānam arcir ādigatiṃ vinā /
analyzed: nayāmi paramam sthānam arciḥ ādigatim vinā
translated: I lead them to the highest abode without the path of light, etc.

original: garuḍaskandham āropya yatheccham anivāritaḥ //
analyzed: garuḍa skandham āropya yatheccham a nivāritaḥ
translated: and being placed on the back of Garuḍa, he can go as he wishes, without obstruction.

original: iti vārāhavacanāt /🔽karmādinirapekṣāpi bhaktir abhīṣṭasādhikā
analyzed: iti vārāha vacanāt
translated: Thus it is said in the Varāha Purāṇa.🔽Devotion, even without depending on karma etc., is the means of attaining the desired goal.

original: yā vai sādhanasampattiḥ puruṣārthacatuṣṭaye /
analyzed: yā vai sādhana sampattiḥ puruṣa artha catuṣṭaye
translated: That perfection of means in the four human goals,

original: tayā vinā tad āpnoti naro nārāyaṇāśrayaḥ //
analyzed: tayā vinā tat āpnoti naraḥ nārāyaṇa āśrayaḥ
