translated: without which a man does not attain them, he attains by taking refuge in Nārāyaṇa.

original: iti nārāyaṇīyāt /
analyzed: iti nārāyaṇīyāt
translated: Thus it is said in the Nārāyaṇīya.

original: sarvadharmojjhitā viṣṇor nāmamātraikajalpakāḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma ujjhitāḥ viṣṇoḥ nāma mātra eka jalpakāḥ
translated: Those who have abandoned all duties, who merely chant the name of Viṣṇu,

original: sukhena yāṃ gatiṃ yānti na tāṃ sarve 'pi dhārmikāḥ //
analyzed: sukhena yām gatim yānti na tām sarve dhārmikāḥ
translated: easily attain that goal which all the righteous do not attain.

original: iti pādmāc ca ////
analyzed: iti pādmāt ca
translated: Thus it is said in the Padma Purāṇa.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṃ niveśaya /
analyzed: mayi eva manaḥ ādhatsva mayi buddhim niveśaya
translated: Fix your mind on Me alone, direct your intellect towards Me.

original: nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṃ na saṃśayaḥ ////
analyzed: nivasiṣyasi mayi eva atas ūrdhvam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: You will certainly dwell in Me alone from now on.

original: śrīdharaḥ yasmād evaṃ tasmāt mayy eveti /🔽mayy eva saṅkalpavikalpātmakaṃ mana ādhatsva sthirīkuru /
analyzed: mayi eva saṅkalpa vikalpa ātmakam manaḥ ādhatsva sthirīkuru
translated: Śrīdhara: Since it is so, therefore, 'on Me alone'.🔽Fix your mind, which consists of thought and imagination, on Me alone, make it steady.

original: buddhim api vyavasāyātmikāṃ mayy eva niveśaya /
analyzed: buddhim api vyavasāya ātmikām mayi eva niveśaya
translated: Also direct your intellect, which consists of determination, towards Me alone.

original: evaṃ kurvan matprasādena labdhajñānaḥ san ata ata ūrdhvaṃ dehānte mayy eva nivasiṣyasi nivatsyasi /
analyzed: evam kurvat mad prasādena labdha jñānaḥ san atas atas ūrdhvam dehānte mayi eva nivasiṣyasi nivatsyasi
translated: By doing so, having attained knowledge through My grace, you will dwell in Me alone, from now on, after this body.

original: yad ātmanā vāsaṃ kariṣyasi /
analyzed: yat ātmanā vāsam kariṣyasi
translated: You will dwell in Me.

original: nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt about this.

original: yathā ca śrutiḥ dehānte devaḥ paraṃ brahmā tārakaṃ vyacaṣṭe iti ////
analyzed: yathā ca śrutiḥ dehānte devaḥ param brahmā tārakam vyacaṣṭe iti
translated: And as the Vedic text says: At the end of the body, the god, the supreme Brahman, reveals the liberator.

original: madhusūdanaḥ tad evam iyatā prabandhena saguṇopāsanāṃ stutvedānīṃ vidhatte mayy eveti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ tat evam iyatā prabandhena saguṇa upāsanām stutvā idānīm vidhatte mayi eva iti
translated: Madhusudana: Having thus praised the meditation with attributes for this long, he now enjoins it with Mayi eva (in Me alone).

original: mayy eva saguṇe brahmaṇi manaḥ saṅkalpavikalpātmakam ādhatsva sthāpaya sarvā manovṛttīr madviṣayā eva kuru /
analyzed: mayi eva saguṇe brahmaṇi manaḥ saṅkalpa vikalpa ātmakam ādhatsva sthāpaya sarvāḥ manaḥ vṛttīḥ mad viṣayāḥ eva kuru
translated: Fix your mind, which consists of intentions and deliberations, in Me alone, the Brahman with attributes. Make all mental activities related to Me alone.

original: evakārānuṣaṅgena mayy eva buddhim adhyavasāyalakṣaṇāṃ niveśaya /
analyzed: eva kāra anuṣaṅgena mayi eva buddhim adhyavasāya lakṣaṇām niveśaya
translated: By the implication of the word eva (alone), direct your intellect, which is characterized by determination, in Me alone.

original: sarvā buddhivṛttīr madviṣayā eva kuru /
analyzed: sarvāḥ buddhi vṛttīḥ mad viṣayāḥ eva kuru
translated: Make all intellectual activities related to Me alone.

original: viṣayāntaraparityāgena sarvadā māṃ cintayety arthaḥ /
analyzed: viṣaya antara parityāgena sarvadā mām cintaya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: think of Me always, by abandoning other objects.

original: tataḥ kiṃ syād ity ata āha nivasiṣyasi nivatsyasi labdhajñānaḥ san madātmanā mayy eva śuddha ata ūrdhvam etaddehānte na saṃśayo nātra pratibandhaśaṅkā
analyzed: tatas kim syāt iti atas āha nivasiṣyasi nivatsyasi labdha jñānaḥ san mad ātmanā mayi eva śuddha atas ūrdhvam etat dehānte na saṃśayaḥ na atra pratibandha śaṅkā  /
translated: What will happen then? To this he says: Nivasiṣyasi (you will dwell). Having attained knowledge, you will dwell in Me alone, in My pure Self, from now on, at the end of this body. There is no doubt about this. There is no doubt about this.

original: kartavyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: kartavyā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: there is no doubt about this.

original: eva ata ūrdhvam ity atra sandhyabhāvaḥ ślokapūraṇārthaḥ ////
analyzed: eva atas ūrdhvam iti atra sandhya bhāvaḥ śloka pūraṇa arthaḥ
translated: The absence of sandhi in eva and at ūrdhvam (from now on) is for the sake of filling out the verse.

original: viśvanāthaḥ yasmān madbhaktir eva śreṣṭhā tasmāt tvaṃ bhaktim eva kurv iti tām upadiśati mayy eveti tribhiḥ /
translated: Visvanatha: Since devotion to Me is the best, therefore, instruct that you should practice devotion alone with three verses beginning with mayy eva.

original: evakāreṇa nirviśeṣavyāvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: eva kāreṇa nirviśeṣa vyāvṛttiḥ
translated: By the word eva (alone), devotion to the formless Brahman is excluded.

original: mayi śyāmasundare pītāmbare vanamālini mana ādhatsva matsmaraṇaṃ kurv ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: mayi śyāma sundare pīta ambare vanamālini manaḥ ādhatsva mad smaraṇam kuru iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: fix your mind on Me, the dark handsome one, wearing yellow garments, and a garland of forest flowers, i.e., remember Me.

original: tathā buddhiṃ vivekavatīṃ niveśaya manmananaṃ kurv ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tathā buddhim vivekavatīm niveśaya mad mananam kuru iti arthaḥ
translated: Similarly, direct your intelligence, which is endowed with discrimination, i.e., think of Me.

original: tac ca mananaṃ dhyānapratipādakaśāstravākyānuśīlanam /
analyzed: tat ca mananam dhyāna pratipādaka śāstra vākya anuśīlanam
translated: And that thinking is the contemplation of the statements of scriptures that teach meditation.

original: tataś ca mayy eva nivasiṣyasīti chāndasam /
analyzed: tatas ca mayi eva nivasiṣyasi iti chāndasam
translated: And then, you will dwell in Me alone. This is in the Vedic style.

original: matsamīpa eva nivāsaṃ prāpnoṣīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: mad samīpe eva nivāsam prāpnoṣi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: you will attain residence near Me.

original: baladevaḥ yasmād evaṃ tasmāt tvaṃ mayy eva na tu svātmani mana ādhatsva samāhitaṃ kuru /
analyzed: baladevaḥ yasmāt evam tasmāt tvam mayi eva na tu svātmani manaḥ ādhatsva samāhitam kuru
translated: Balarama: Since it is so, therefore, fix your mind on Me alone, not on your own self, and make it concentrated.

original: buddhiṃ mayi niveśayārpaya /
analyzed: buddhim mayi niveśaya arpaya
translated: Direct your intelligence towards Me.

original: evaṃ kurvāṇas tvaṃ mayy eva mama kṛṣṇasya sannidhāv eva nivatsyasi /
analyzed: evam kurvāṇaḥ tvam mayi eva mama kṛṣṇasya sannidhau eva nivatsyasi
translated: By doing so, you will dwell in Me alone, in the presence of Me, Krishna.

original: na tu saniṣṭhavat sargādikam anubhavann aiśvaryapradhānaṃ māṃ prāpsyasīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: na tu saniṣṭha vat sarga ādikam anubhavan aiśvarya pradhānam mām prāpsyasi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: you will not attain Me, who am predominated by opulence, experiencing creation etc. like one who is absorbed in Me.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita.

original: atha cittaṃ samādhātuṃ na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram /
analyzed: atha cittam samādhātum na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram
translated: But if you are unable to steady your mind on Me,

original: abhyāsayogena tato mām icchāptuṃ dhanaṃjaya ////
analyzed: abhyāsa yogena tatas mām iccha āptum dhanaṃjaya
translated: then, O Dhananjaya, strive to attain Me by the yoga of practice.

original: śrīdharaḥ atrāśaktaṃ prati sugamopāyam āha atheti /🔽sthiraṃ yathā bhavaty evaṃ mayi cittaṃ dhārayituṃ yadi śakto na bhavasi tarhi vikṣiptaṃ
analyzed: sthiram yathā bhavati evam mayi cittam dhārayitum yadi śaktaḥ na bhavasi tarhi vikṣiptam
translated: Here, for one who is unable, Sri Sridhara says the easy means is stated by atha (but).🔽If you are not able to hold the mind on Me in such a way that it becomes steady, then repeatedly withdrawing the distracted mind,

original: cittaṃ punaḥ punaḥ pratyāhṛtya madanusmaraṇalakṣaṇo yo 'bhyāsayogas tena māṃ prāptum iccha /
analyzed: cittam punar punar pratyāhṛtya mad anusmaraṇa lakṣaṇaḥ yaḥ bhyāsa yogaḥ tena mām prāptum iccha
translated: strive to attain Me by the yoga of practice, which is characterized by the recollection of Me.

original: prayatnaṃ kuru ////
analyzed: prayatnam kuru
translated: Make an effort.

original: madhusūdanaḥ idānīṃ saguṇabrahmadhyānāśaktānām aśaktitāratāmyena prathamaṃ pratimādau
translated: Madhusudana: Now, for those who are unable to meditate on Brahman with qualities, three means are prescribed by three verses: first, the practice of meditating on the external Lord in an image,

original: bāhye bhagavaddhyānābhyāsas tadaśaktau bhāgavatadharmānuṣṭhānaṃ tadaśaktau sarvakarmaphalatyāga
analyzed: bāhye bhagavat dhyāna abhyāsaḥ tad aśaktau bhāgavata dharma anuṣṭhānam tad aśaktau sarva karma phala tyāga
translated: if unable to do that, the performance of the duties of a devotee, if unable to do that, the renunciation of the fruits of all actions.

original: iti trīṇi sādhanāni tribhiḥ ślokair vidhatte atheti /
analyzed: iti trīṇi sādhanāni tribhiḥ ślokaiḥ vidhatte atha iti
translated: He says atha (but).

original: atha pakṣāntare sthiraṃ yathā syāt tathā cittaṃ samādhātuṃ sthāpayituṃ mayi na śaknoṣi
analyzed: atha pakṣa antare sthiram yathā syāt tathā cittam samādhātum sthāpayitum mayi na śaknoṣi
translated: But if you are unable to steady your mind on Me in such a way that it becomes steady,

original: cet tata ekasmin pratimādāv ālambane sarvataḥ samāhṛtya cetasaḥ punaḥ punaḥ sthāpanam
analyzed: ced tatas ekasmin pratimā ādau ālambane sarvatas samāhṛtya cetasaḥ punar punar sthāpanam
translated: If so, then, in one object of meditation such as an image, the mind is repeatedly withdrawn from all other objects and fixed again and again.

original: abhyāsas tatpūrvako yogaḥ samādhis tenābhyāsayogena mām āptum iccha yatasva /
analyzed: abhyāsaḥ tad pūrvakaḥ yogaḥ samādhiḥ tena abhyāsa yogena mām āptum iccha yatasva
translated: That is practice. Yoga preceded by that is concentration. By that practice-yoga, strive to attain Me.

original: he dhanañjaya /
analyzed: he dhanañjaya
translated: O Dhananjaya.

original: bahūn śatrūn jitvā dhanam āhṛtavān asi rājasūyādyartham ekaṃ manaḥśatruṃ jitvā tatvajñānadhanam āhariṣyasīti na tavāścaryam iti sambodhanārthaḥ
analyzed: bahūn śatrūn jitvā dhanam āhṛtavān asi rājasūya ādi artham ekam manaḥ śatrum jitvā āhariṣyasi iti na tava āścaryam iti sambodhana arthaḥ
translated: It is not surprising that you, having conquered many enemies and won wealth for the purpose of the Rajasuya and so on, will conquer the one enemy of the mind and win the wealth of the knowledge of reality. Thus the address is for that purpose.

original: viśvanāthaḥ sākṣāt smaraṇāsamarthaṃ prati tatprāptyupāyam āha atheti /
translated: Visvanatha says that for one unable to directly remember, he states the means of attaining that with the words atha (now).

original: abhyāsayogenānyatrānyatra gatam api manaḥ punaḥ pratyāhṛtya madrūpa eva sthāpanam abhyāsaḥ /
analyzed: abhyāsa yogena anyatra anyatra gatam api manaḥ punar pratyāhṛtya mad rūpe eva sthāpanam abhyāsaḥ
translated: Practice is the withdrawal of the mind again and again, even when gone elsewhere, and fixing it on My form alone.

original: sa eva yogas tena /🔽prākṛtatvād iti kutsitarūparasādiṣu calantyā manonadyās teṣu calanaṃ nirudhya atisubhadreṣu madīyarūparasādiṣu taccalanaṃ śanaiḥ śanaiḥ
analyzed: saḥ eva yogaḥ tena  prākṛta tvāt iti kutsita rūpa rasa ādiṣu calantyāḥ manaḥ nadyāḥ teṣu calanam nirudhya ati su bhadreṣu madīya rūpa rasa ādiṣu tat calanam śanais śanais
translated: That itself is yoga. By that.

original: sampādayety arthaḥ /
analyzed: sampādaya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that one should gradually accomplish the flow of that river of the mind, which moves due to its natural tendency towards contemptible forms, tastes, etc., by stopping its flow towards those, and directing it towards My extremely beautiful forms, tastes, etc.

original: he dhanañjayeti bahūn śatrūn jitvā dhanam āhṛtavatā tvayā mano 'pi jitvā dhyānadhanaṃ grahītuṃ śakyam eveti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: he dhanañjaya iti bahūn śatrūn jitvā dhanam āhṛtavatā tvayā manaḥ pi jitvā dhyāna dhanam grahītum śakyam eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: O Dhananjaya, the idea is that having conquered many enemies and won wealth, you can also conquer the mind and win the wealth of meditation.

original: baladevaḥ nanu gaṅgeva yeṣāṃ manovṛttirodhavatī teṣāṃ tvatprāptis tvarayā syān mama tu tādṛśī na tadvṛttis tataḥ kathaṃ seti cet tatrāha
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu gaṅgā iva yeṣām manaḥ vṛtti rodhavatī teṣām tvad prāptiḥ tvarayā syāt mama tu tādṛśī na tad vṛttiḥ tatas katham sā iti ced tatra āha
translated: Balarama: If you ask, How can I attain You, since my mind is not like that, which is full of the obstruction of mental activity like the Ganges, and I have no haste to attain You? then He says:

original: atheti /
analyzed: atha iti
translated: Atha (if).

original: sthiraṃ yathā syāt tathā mayi cittaṃ samyag anāyāsenādhātum arpayituṃ na śaknoṣi cet tato 'bhyāsayogena mām āptum iccha yatasva /
analyzed: sthiram yathā syāt tathā mayi cittam samyak anāyāsena ādhātum arpayitum na śaknoṣi ced tatas bhyāsa yogena mām āptum iccha yatasva
translated: If you are unable to place your mind firmly in Me without great effort, then strive to attain Me through the yoga of practice.

original: tato 'nyatra gatasya manasaḥ pratyāhṛtya śanaiḥ śanair mayi sthāpanam abhyāsas tena manasi matpravaṇe sati matprāptiḥ sulabhā syād iti bhāvaḥ
analyzed: tatas nyatra gatasya manasaḥ pratyāhṛtya śanais śanais mayi sthāpanam abhyāsaḥ tena manasi mad pravaṇe sati mad prāptiḥ sulabhā syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that when the mind is inclined towards Me through practice, which is the gradual withdrawal and placement of the mind in Me that has gone elsewhere, the attainment of Me will be easy.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: abhyāse 'py asamartho 'si matkarmaparamo bhava /
analyzed: abhyāse pi asamarthaḥ si mad karma paramaḥ bhava
translated: If you are unable to practice, then be devoted to My actions.

original: madartham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi ////
analyzed: mad artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi
translated: By performing actions for My sake, you will attain perfection.

original: śrīdharaḥ yadi punar naivaṃ tatrāha abhyāsa iti /
translated: Sridhar: If again it is not so, then He says abhyase (in practice).

original: yadi punar abhyāse 'py aśakto 'si tarhi matprītyarthāni yāni karmāṇi ekādaśyupavāsavratacaryāpūjānāmasaṅkīrtanādīni tadanuṣṭhānam
analyzed: yadi punar abhyāse pi aśaktaḥ si tarhi mad prīti arthāni yāni karmāṇi ekādaśī upavāsa vrata caryā pūjā nāma saṅkīrtana ādīni tad anuṣṭhānam
translated: If, however, you are unable to practise even that, then you should be one who is intent on the performance of those actions which are for My satisfaction, such as the vow of fasting on the Ekadasi day, the observance of the vow of worship, the chanting of the holy name, etc.

original: eva paramaṃ yasya tādṛśo bhava /
analyzed: eva paramam yasya tādṛśaḥ bhava
translated: Be one who is intent on that alone.

original: evaṃbhūtāni karmāṇy api madarthaṃ kurvan mokṣaṃ prāpsyasi ////
analyzed: evaṃbhūtāni karmāṇi api mad artham kurvan mokṣam prāpsyasi
translated: By performing such actions also for My sake, you will attain liberation.

original: madhusūdanaḥ matprīṇanārthaṃ karma matkarma śravaṇakīrtanādibhāgavatadharmas tatparamas tadekaniṣṭho bhava /
translated: Madhusudana: Be one who is intent on My actions, i.e. on the duties of a devotee such as hearing and chanting about Me, etc.

original: abhyāsāsamarthye madarthaṃ bhāgavatadharmasaṃjñakāni karmāṇy api kurvan siddhiṃ brahmabhāvalakṣaṇāṃ sattvaśuddhijñānotpattidvāreṇāvāpsyasi
analyzed: abhyāsa asamarthye mad artham bhāgavata dharma saṃjñakāni karmāṇi api kurvan siddhim brahma bhāva lakṣaṇām sattva śuddhi jñāna utpatti dvāreṇa avāpsyasi
translated: Even by performing actions for My sake, which are called the duties of a devotee, you will attain perfection, which is characterized by the attainment of Brahman, by the process of purifying the mind and the arising of knowledge, if you are unable to practise that.🔽Visvanatha: Even if you are unable to practise that, then you should be one who is intent on the performance of actions which are called the duties of a devotee and which are for My satisfaction.🔽By performing those actions also for My sake, you will attain perfection, which is characterized by the attainment of Brahman, by the process of purifying the mind and the arising of knowledge, if you are unable to practise that.

original: viśvanāthaḥ abhyāse 'pīti yathā pittadūṣitā rasanā matsyaṇḍikāṃ necchati /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ abhyāse pīti yathā pitta dūṣitā rasanā matsyaṇḍikām na icchati
translated: The mind, being polluted by ignorance, does not accept even the sweet things like form, etc., just as the tongue polluted by bile does not accept sugar.

original: tathaivāvidyādūṣitaṃ manas tadrūpādikaṃ madhuram api na gṛhṇātīty atas tena durgraheṇa mahāprabalena manasā saha yoddhuṃ mayā naiva śakyata
analyzed: tathā eva avidyā dūṣitam manaḥ tad rūpa ādikam madhuram api na gṛhṇāti iti atas tena durgraheṇa mahā prabalena manasā saha yoddhum mayā nā eva śakyata
translated: Therefore, I am not able to fight with that very difficult to grasp and very powerful mind.

original: iti manyase ced iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: iti manyase ced iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that if you think thus.

original: matkarmāṇi paramāṇi yasya saḥ /
analyzed: mad karmāṇi paramāṇi yasya saḥ
translated: He whose actions are mine, he is so.

original: karmāṇi madīyaśravaṇakīrtanavandanārcanamanmandiramārjanābhyukṣaṇapuṣpāharaṇādiparicaraṇādi
analyzed: karmāṇi madīya śravaṇa kīrtana vandana arcana mad mandira mārjana abhyukṣaṇa puṣpa āharaṇa ādi paricaraṇa ādi
translated: Performing actions such as listening to and glorifying me, worshipping, offering worship, sweeping and sprinkling my temple, bringing flowers, and rendering service etc.,

original: kurvan vināpi matsmaraṇaṃ siddhiṃ premavatpārṣadatvalakṣaṇāṃ prāpsyatīti // //
analyzed: kurvan vinā api mad smaraṇam siddhim premavat pārṣada tva lakṣaṇām prāpsyati iti
translated: even without remembering me, he will attain perfection characterized by becoming a dear attendant.

original: baladevaḥ nanu vāyor iva manaso 'ticāpalyāt tasya pratyāhāre mama na śaktir iti cet tatrāha abhyāse 'pīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu vāyoḥ iva ti cāpalyāt tasya pratyāhāre mama na śaktiḥ iti ced tatra āha abhyāse pi iti
translated: Balarama: If you think that you are incapable of withdrawing the mind due to its extreme fickleness like that of the wind, then he says abhyase 'pi (even in practice).

original: uktalakṣaṇe 'bhyāse 'pi cet tvam asamarthas tarhi matkarmāṇi paramāṇi pumarthabhūtāni yasya tādṛśo bhava /
analyzed: ukta lakṣaṇe bhyāse ced tvam asamarthaḥ tarhi mad karmāṇi paramāṇi pumartha bhūtāni yasya tādṛśaḥ bhava
translated: If you are incapable even in the practice described above, then be one whose actions are mine, whose actions are the highest goals of human life.

original: tāni ca manniketanirmāṇamatpuṣpabāṭīsecanādīni pūrvam uktāni /🔽evaṃ sukarāṇi madarthāni karmāṇi kurvāṇas tvaṃ tatra tarātimanojñamanmūrtyuddeśamahimnā
analyzed: tāni ca mad niketa nirmāṇa mad puṣpa bāṭī secana ādīni pūrvam uktāni  evam sukarāṇi mad arthāni karmāṇi kurvāṇaḥ tvam tatra tara ati manojña mad mūrti uddeśa mahimnā
translated: And those actions are the construction of my abode, sprinkling the flower garden of mine, and so on, as mentioned before.

original: tādṛśe mayi niratamanāḥ saṃsiddhiṃ matsāmīpyalakṣaṇām avāpsyasīty atisugamo 'yam upāyaḥ // //
analyzed: tādṛśe mayi nirata manāḥ saṃsiddhim mad sāmīpya lakṣaṇām avāpsyasi iti ati sugamaḥ yam upāyaḥ
translated: Performing these actions for me, which are easy to do, you will attain perfection characterized by proximity to me, by the greatness of being the object of my extremely delightful form. This is an extremely easy means.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: athaitad apy aśakto 'si kartuṃ madyogam āśritaḥ /
analyzed: athā etat api aśaktaḥ si kartum mad yogam āśritaḥ
translated: If you are unable to do even this, then, resorting to My yoga,

original: sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān ////
analyzed: sarva karma phala tyāgam tatas kuru yata ātmavān
translated: renounce the fruits of all actions, O scorcher of enemies.

original: śrīdharaḥ atyantaṃ bhagavaddharmapariniṣṭhāyām aśaktasya pakṣāntaram āha atheti /🔽yady etad api kartuṃ na śaknoṣi tarhi madayogaṃ madekaśaraṇatvam āśritaḥ san sarveṣāṃ
analyzed: yadi etat api kartum na śaknoṣi tarhi mad ayogam mad eka śaraṇa tvam āśritaḥ san sarveṣām
translated: Śrīdhara: For one who is completely unable to perfect the Lord's devotional service, an alternative is stated with If, however.

original: dṛṣṭādṛṣṭārthānām āvaśyakānāṃ cāgnihotrādikarmaṇāṃ phalāni niyatacittaṃ bhūs tvā parityaja /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa adṛṣṭa arthānām āvaśyakānām ca agnihotra ādi karmaṇām phalāni niyata cittam bhūḥ tvā parityaja
translated: If you are unable to do even this, then, resorting to My yoga, which is taking refuge in Me alone, O scorcher of enemies, renounce the fruits of all actions, necessary actions like Agnihotra, and of all visible and invisible goals.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati mayā tāvad īśvarājñayā yathāśakti karmāṇi kartavyāni /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati mayā tāvat īśvara ājñayā yathāśakti karmāṇi kartavyāni
translated: This is what is being said: By the order of the Lord, actions should be performed to the best of one's ability.

original: phalaṃ tāvad dṛṣṭam adṛṣṭaṃ vā parameśvarādhīnam ity evaṃ mayi bhāram āropya phalāsaktiṃ parityajya vartamāno matprasādena kṛtārtho bhaviṣyasīti
analyzed: phalam tāvat dṛṣṭam adṛṣṭam vā parameśvara adhīnam iti evam mayi bhāram āropya phala āsaktim parityajya vartamānaḥ mad prasādena kṛtārthaḥ bhaviṣyasi iti
translated: The fruits, whether seen or unseen, are dependent on the Supreme Lord. Thus, placing the burden on Me, abandoning attachment to fruits, and acting, you will become successful by My grace.

original: madhusūdanaḥ atha bahirviṣayākṛṣṭacetastvād etanmatkarmaparatvam api kartuṃ na śaknoṣi /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ atha bahis viṣaya ākṛṣṭa cetaḥ tvāt etat mad karma paratvam api kartum na śaknoṣi
translated: Madhusūdana: If, due to the mind being attracted to external objects, you are unable to perform even this devotion to My actions,

original: tato madyogaṃ madekaśaraṇatvam āśrito mayi sarvakarmasamarpaṇaṃ madyogas taṃ
analyzed: tatas mad yogam mad eka śaraṇa tvam āśritaḥ mayi sarva karma samarpaṇam mad yogaḥ tam
translated: Then, having resorted to Madhyoga, i.e. taking refuge in Me alone, one should perform the renunciation of all actions in Me, that Madhyoga,

original: vāśritaḥ san yatātmavān yataḥ saṃyatasarvendriya ātmavān vivekī ca san sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ
analyzed: vā āśritaḥ san yata ātmavān yatas saṃyata sarva indriyaḥ ātmavān vivekī ca san sarva karma phala tyāgam
translated: having resorted to that, being self-controlled, i.e. having controlled all the senses, and being self-possessed, i.e. discriminating, one should perform the renunciation of the fruits of all actions,

original: kuru phalābhisandhiṃ tyajety arthaḥ // //
analyzed: kuru phala abhisandhim tyaja iti arthaḥ
translated: renounce the desire for results, is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ etad api kartum aśaktaś cet tarhi madyogam āśrito mayi sarvakarmasamarpaṇam /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ etat api kartum aśaktaḥ ced tarhi mad yogam āśritaḥ mayi sarva karma samarpaṇam
translated: Visvanatha: If one is unable to do even this, then one should resort to Madhyoga, i.e. dedicate all actions to Me.

original: madyogas tam āśritaḥ san sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ prathamaṣaṭkoktaṃ kuru /
analyzed: mad yogaḥ tam āśritaḥ san sarva karma phala tyāgam prathama ṣaṭka uktam kuru
translated: Having resorted to that Madhyoga, one should perform the renunciation of the fruits of all actions, as stated in the first six verses.

original: ayam arthaḥ prathamaṣaṭke bhagavadarpitaniṣkāmakarmayoga eva mokṣopāya uktaḥ /
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ prathama ṣaṭke bhagavat arpita niṣkāma karma yogaḥ eva mokṣa upāyaḥ uktaḥ
translated: The meaning is this: In the first six verses, the means of attaining liberation is stated to be the yoga of action dedicated to the Lord without desire for results.

original: dvitīyaṣaṭke 'smin bhaktiyoga eva bhagavatprāptyupāya uktaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīya ṣaṭke smin bhakti yogaḥ eva bhagavat prāpti upāyaḥ uktaḥ
translated: In this second set of six verses, the means of attaining the Lord is stated to be devotion alone.

original: sa ca bhaktiyogo dvividhaḥ bhagavanniṣṭho 'ntaḥkaraṇavyāpāro /
analyzed: sa ca bhaktiyogaḥ dvividhaḥ bhagavat niṣṭhaḥ ntaḥkaraṇa vyāpāraḥ
translated: And that devotion is of two kinds: that which is based on the Lord and is the activity of the internal organ,

original: bahiṣkaraṇavyāpāraś ca /
analyzed: bahiṣkaraṇa vyāpāraḥ ca
translated: and that which is the activity of the external organs.

original: tatra prathamas trividhaḥ smaraṇātmako /
analyzed: tatra prathamaḥ trividhaḥ
translated: Among them, the first is of three kinds: that which is of the nature of remembrance,

original: mananātmakaś cākhaṇḍasmaraṇāsāmarthye tadanurāgināṃ tadabhyāsarūpaṃ ceti trika evāyaṃ mandadhiyāṃ durgamaḥ /
analyzed: manana ātmakaḥ ca akhaṇḍa smaraṇa asāmarthye tad anurāginām tad abhyāsa rūpam ca iti trikaḥ eva ayam manda dhiyām durgamaḥ
translated: And it is threefold: meditation, which is the essence of the mind; and repetition, which is the form of practice for those who are devoted to it when they are unable to meditate continuously. This is indeed difficult for those of slow intellect.

original: sudhiyāṃ niraparādhānāṃ tu sugama eva /
analyzed: sudhiyām niraparādhānām tu sugamaḥ eva
translated: But for those of sharp intellect, who are free from faults, it is indeed easy.

original: dvitīyaḥ śravaṇakīrtanātmakaṃ tu sarveṣāṃ sugama evopāyaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ śravaṇa kīrtana ātmakam tu sarveṣām sugamaḥ eva upāyaḥ
translated: The second [means] is easy for all: hearing and glorifying.

original: evam ubhayopāyavanto 'dhikāriṇaḥ sarvataḥ prakṛṣṭā dvitīyaṣaṭke🔽'sminn uktāḥ /🔽etatkṛtyasamarthā indriyāṇāṃ bhagavanniṣṭhīkṛtāv aśraddhālavaś ca bhagavadarpitaniṣkāmakarmiṇaḥ prathamaṣaṭkotādhikāriṇo 'smān nikṛṣṭā
analyzed: evam ubhaya upāyavantaḥ dhikāriṇaḥ sarvatas prakṛṣṭāḥ dvitīya ṣaṭke  smin uktāḥ  etad kṛtya samarthāḥ indriyāṇām bhagavat niṣṭhīkṛtau aśraddhālavaḥ ca bhagavat arpita niṣkāma karmiṇaḥ prathama ṣaṭka uta adhikāriṇaḥ smāt nikṛṣṭā  /
translated: Thus, those who possess both means, being the most excellent in every way, are mentioned in this second set of six.🔽Those who are able to perform this [means], who have dedicated their senses to the Lord, and who are faithful, are the qualified persons mentioned in the first set of six. They are inferior to us.

original: eveti ////🔽baladevaḥ atha mahākulīnatvalokamukhyatvādinā pratibandhena bādhitas tvam anyo
analyzed: eva iti  baladevaḥ atha mahā kulīna tva loka mukhya tva ādinā pratibandhena bādhitaḥ tvam
translated: Thus, O Lord, we are indeed superior to them.

original: vai tanmanniketavimārjanādimatprītikaramatisukaram api karma cet kartum aśakto
analyzed: vai tat mad niketa vimārjana ādimat prīti karam ati sukaram api karma ced kartum
translated: [The Lord said:] O Arjuna, if you are unable to perform even the very easy rites that bring Me pleasure, such as sweeping the temple, etc., which are obstructed by such hindrances as being born in a great family, being the chief of the people, etc.,

original: 'si tato madyogaṃ maccharaṇatām āśritaḥ san sarveṣām anuṣṭhīyamānānāṃ karmaṇāṃ
analyzed: tatas mad yogam mad śaraṇa tām āśritaḥ san sarveṣām anuṣṭhīyamānānām karmaṇām
translated: then, having resorted to My yoga, i.e. taking refuge in Me, you should perform all the rites that are being performed by all [people].

original: phalatyāgaṃ kuru yatātmavān vijitamanā bhūtvā /
analyzed: phala tyāgam kuru yata ātmavān vijita manāḥ bhūtvā
translated: Renounce the fruits, being self-controlled and having conquered the mind.

original: tathā ca phalābhisandhiśūnyair agnihotradarśapaurṇamāsyādibhir madārādhanarūpaiḥ
analyzed: tathā ca phala abhisandhi śūnyaiḥ agnihotra darśa paurṇamāsī ādibhiḥ mad ārādhana rūpaiḥ
translated: And thus, by actions like Agnihotra, Darsha-Purnamāsa etc., which are in the form of worshipping Me and are devoid of the desire for fruits,

original: karmabhir viṣatantuvadantarabhyuditena jñānena svaparātmanoḥ śeṣaśeṣibhāve
analyzed: karmabhiḥ viṣa tantu vat antar abhyuditena jñānena sva para ātmanoḥ śeṣa śeṣi bhāve
translated: by knowledge that has arisen within like a thread of poison, when the relationship of subordinate and principal between one's own self and others is

original: 'bhyudite svaśeṣiṇi sarvottamatvena vidite śanaiḥ śanaiḥ parāpi bhaktiḥ syād iti /
analyzed: abhyudite sva śeṣiṇi sarva uttama tvena vidite śanais śanais parā api bhaktiḥ syāt iti
translated: manifested, when one's own principal is known as the highest of all, then devotion to others will gradually arise.

original: evam eva vakṣyati yataḥ pravṛttir bhūtānāṃ ity ādinā madbhaktiṃ labhate parām ity anena ////
analyzed: evam eva vakṣyati yatas pravṛttiḥ bhūtānām iti ādinā mad bhaktim labhate parām iti anena
translated: He will say the same thing with From which there is the activity of beings etc. and one attains the highest devotion to Me etc.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: śreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṃ viśiṣyate /
analyzed: śreyaḥ hi jñānam abhyāsāt jñānāt dhyānam viśiṣyate
translated: Knowledge is better than study; meditation is superior to knowledge.

original: dhyānāt karmaphalatyāgas tyāgāc chāntir anantaram ////
analyzed: dhyānāt karma phala tyāgaḥ tyāgāt śāntiḥ anantaram
translated: From meditation, renunciation of the fruits of action; from renunciation, peace follows immediately.

original: śrīdharaḥ tam imaṃ phalatyāgaṃ stauti śreya iti /
analyzed: stauti   iti
translated: Sridhar says: He praises this renunciation of fruits with Sreyah etc.

original: samyagjñānarahitād abhyāsāt yuktisahitopadeśapūrvakaṃ jñānaṃ śreṣṭham /
analyzed: samyak jñāna rahitāt abhyāsāt yukti sahita upadeśa pūrvakam jñānam śreṣṭham
translated: Knowledge preceded by reasoning and instruction is better than study devoid of perfect knowledge.

original: tasmād api tatpūrvaṃ dhyānaṃ viśiṣṭam /
analyzed: tasmāt api tad pūrvam dhyānam viśiṣṭam
translated: Meditation preceded by that is superior to that also.

original: tatas tu taṃ paśyati niṣkalaṃ dhyāyamāna iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: tatas tu tam paśyati niṣkalam dhyāyamānaḥ iti śruteḥ
translated: Then he sees that which is free from parts, by meditating on It, as the Vedic text says.

original: tasmād apy uktalakṣaṇaḥ karmaphalatyāgaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt api ukta lakṣaṇaḥ karma phala tyāgaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ
translated: Therefore, the renunciation of the fruits of action, as described above, is the best.

original: tasmād evaṃbhūtāt karmaphalatyāgāt karmasu tatphaleṣu cāsaktinivṛttyā matprasādena ca samanantaram eva saṃsāraśāntir bhavati ////
analyzed: tasmāt evaṃbhūtāt karma phala tyāgāt karmasu tad phaleṣu ca āsakti nivṛttyā mad prasādena ca samanantaram eva saṃsāra śāntiḥ bhavati
translated: Therefore, from such renunciation of the fruits of action, by the cessation of attachment to actions and their fruits and by My grace, the cessation of worldly existence occurs immediately.

original: madhusūdanaḥ idānīm atraiva sādhanavidhānaprayavasānād imaṃ sarvaphalatyāgaṃ stauti śreya iti /
translated: Madhusudana now praises this renunciation of all fruits, which concludes the injunction of the means in this very [Upanishad], with the word shreya [in the verse].

original: śreyaḥ praśasyataraṃ hi eva jñānaṃ śabdayuktibhyām ātmaniścayo 'bhyāsā jñānārthaśravaṇābhyāsāt /
analyzed: śreyaḥ praśasyataram hi eva jñānam śabda yuktibhyām ātma niścayaḥ bhyāsā jñāna artha śravaṇa abhyāsāt
translated: For knowledge is indeed the most praiseworthy, by the scriptures and reasoning, of the ascertainment of the Self through practice, by the practice of hearing the meaning of knowledge.

original: jñānāc chravaṇamananapariniṣpannād api dhyānaṃ nididhyāsanasaṃjñaṃ viśiṣyate 'tiśayitaṃ bhavati sākṣātkārāvyavahitahetutvāt /
analyzed: jñānāt śravaṇa manana pariniṣpannāt api dhyānam nididhyāsana saṃjñam viśiṣyate tiśayitam bhavati sākṣātkāra avyavahita hetu tvāt
translated: From knowledge, which is accomplished by hearing, reflection, and meditation, even meditation, which is called nididhyasana, is distinguished, is superior, because it is the immediate cause of realization.

original: tad evaṃ sarvasādhanaśreṣṭhaṃ dhyānaṃ tato 'py atiśayitatvenājñakṛtaḥ karmaphalatyāgaḥ stūyate /
analyzed: tat evam sarva sādhana śreṣṭham dhyānam tatas u pi atiśayita tvena ājña kṛtaḥ karma phala tyāgaḥ stūyate
translated: Thus, meditation, which is the best of all means, is praised as being superior even to that, as the renunciation of the fruits of action by one who is ignorant.

original: dhyānāt karmaphalatyāgo viśiṣyata ity anuṣajyate /
analyzed: dhyānāt karma phala tyāgaḥ viśiṣyate iti anuṣajyate
translated: Renunciation of the fruits of action is distinguished from meditation. This is to be supplied.

original: tyāgān niyatacittena puṃsā kṛtāt sarvakarmaphalatyāgāc chāntir upaśamaḥ sahetukasya saṃsārasyānantaram apy avadhānena na tu kālāntaram
analyzed: tyāgāt niyata cittena puṃsā kṛtāt sarva karma phala tyāgāt śāntiḥ upaśamaḥ sa hetukasya saṃsārasya anantaram api avadhānena na tu kāla antaram
translated: Peace, tranquility, is attained immediately after the cycle of birth and death along with its cause, by a person of controlled mind, by renunciation, by giving up the fruits of all actions, and does not require any delay.

original: apekṣate / atra
analyzed: apekṣate atra
translated: Here,

original: yadā sarve pramucyante kāmā ye 'sya hṛdi sthitāḥ /
analyzed: yadā sarve pramucyante kāmāḥ ye sya hṛdi sthitāḥ
translated: When all the desires that are in one's heart are completely given up,

original: atha martyo 'mṛto bhavaty atra brahma samaśnute //
analyzed: atha martyaḥ mṛtaḥ bhavati atra brahma samaśnute
translated: then a mortal becomes immortal, and in this very life he attains Brahman.

original: ity ādi śrutiṣu prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān ity ādisthitaprajñalakṣaṇeṣu ca sarvakāmatyāgasyāmṛtatvasādhanatvam avagatam /
analyzed: iti ādi śrutiṣu prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān iti ādi sthitaprajña lakṣaṇeṣu ca sarva kāma tyāgasya amṛta tva sādhana tvam avagatam
translated: And in the Upanishads beginning with this, and in the characteristics of one whose wisdom is established beginning with when one gives up all desires, the giving up of all desires is understood to be the means of attaining immortality.

original: karmaphalāni ca kāmās tattyāgo 'pi kāmatyāgatvasāmānyāt sarvakāmatyāgaphalena stūyate /
analyzed: karma phalāni ca kāmāḥ tad tyāgaḥ u pi kāma tyāga tva sāmānyāt sarva kāma tyāga phalena stūyate
translated: And the fruits of actions are desires. The giving them up is praised as having the fruit of giving up all desires, because of the similarity of being a giving up of desires.

original: yathāgastyena brāhmaṇena samudraḥ pīta iti /
analyzed: yathā agastyena brāhmaṇena samudraḥ pītaḥ iti
translated: Just as it is said that the ocean was drunk by the Brahmin Agastya,

original: yathā vā jāmadagnyena brāhmaṇena niḥkṣatrā pṛthivī kṛteti bāhmaṇatvasāmānyād idānīntanā api brāhmaṇā aparimeyaparākramatvena stūyante tadvat
analyzed: yathā vā jāmadagnyena brāhmaṇena niḥkṣatrā pṛthivī kṛtā iti bāhmaṇa tva sāmānyāt idānīntanāḥ api brāhmaṇāḥ aparimeya parākrama tvena stūyante tadvat
translated: or just as the earth was made devoid of Kshatriyas by the Brahmin Jamadagni, in the same way, even the present-day Brahmins are praised as having immeasurable prowess because of the similarity of being Brahmins.

original: viśvanāthaḥ athoktānāṃ smaraṇamananābhyāsānāṃ yathāpūrvaṃ śraiṣṭhyaṃ spaṣṭīkṛyāha śreyo hīti /
translated: Visvanatha: Now, to make clear the superiority of the practices of remembrance and meditation in the order mentioned, he says, The best...

original: abhyāsāj jñānaṃ mayi buddhiṃ niveśayety uktaṃ manmananaṃ śreyaḥ śreṣṭham /
analyzed: abhyāsāt jñānam mayi buddhim niveśaya iti uktam mad mananam śreyaḥ śreṣṭham
translated: By practice, one should place the mind in Me - thus, meditation on Me is the best.

original: abhyāse saty āyāsata eva dhyānaṃ syāt /
analyzed: abhyāse sati āyāsataḥ eva dhyānam syāt
translated: When there is practice, meditation will occur effortlessly.

original: manane sati tv anāyāsata eva dhyānam iti viśeṣāt tasmāt jñānād api dhyānaṃ viśiṣyate śreṣṭham ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: manane sati tu anāyāsataḥ eva dhyānam iti viśeṣāt tasmāt jñānāt api dhyānam viśiṣyate śreṣṭham iti arthaḥ
translated: But when there is meditation, meditation will occur effortlessly. Thus, meditation is superior even to knowledge. This is the meaning.

original: kuta ity ata āha dhyānāt karmaphalānāṃ svargādisukhānāṃ niṣkāmakarmaphalasya mokṣasya ca tyāgas tatspṛhārāhityaṃ syāt /
analyzed: kutas iti atas āha dhyānāt karma phalānām svarga ādi sukhānām niṣkāma karma phalasya mokṣasya ca tyāgaḥ tad spṛhā rāhityam syāt
translated: Why? He says, From meditation, there will be renunciation of the fruits of actions, such as the pleasures of heaven, and of liberation, the fruit of selfless action.

original: svataḥ prāptasyāpi tasyopekṣā /
analyzed: svatas prāptasya api tasya upekṣā
translated: Even if it is attained naturally, one should ignore it.

original: niścaladhyānāt pūrvaṃ tu bhaktānām ajātaratīnāṃ mokṣatyāgecchaiva bhavet /
analyzed: niścala dhyānāt pūrvam tu bhaktānām ajāta ratīnām mokṣa tyāga icchā eva bhavet
translated: But for devotees who have not yet attained delight, before unwavering meditation, there will be a desire to renounce liberation.

original: niścaladhyānavatāṃ tu mokṣopekṣā /
analyzed: niścala dhyānavatām tu mokṣa upekṣā
translated: But for those with unwavering meditation, there is indifference to liberation.

original: saiva mokṣalaghutākāriṇī /
analyzed: sā eva mokṣa laghu tā kāriṇī
translated: That itself makes liberation easy.

original: yad uktaṃ bhaktirasāmṛtasindhau kleśaghnī śubhadā BRS / / ity atra ṣaḍbhiḥ
translated: As it is said in the Bhaktirasamritasindhu, It destroys afflictions and bestows auspiciousness - here, with six...

original: padair etanmāhātmyaṃ kīrtitam iti / yad uktaṃ 🔽na pārameṣṭhyaṃ na mahendradhiṣṇyaṃ
analyzed: padaiḥ etat māhātmyam kīrtitam iti yat uktam  na pārameṣṭhyam na mahendra dhiṣṇyam
translated: This greatness has been described by these words. As it is said:🔽Neither the position of Brahmā, nor that of the great Indra,

original: na sārvabhaumaṃ na rasādhipatyam /
analyzed: na sārvabhaumam na rasa ādhipatyam
translated: nor that of the universal monarch, nor lordship over the elements,

original: na yogasiddhīr apunarbhavaṃ vā🔽mayy arpitātmecchati mad vinānyat // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: na yoga siddhīḥ apunarbhavam vā  mayi arpita ātmā icchati mat vinā anyat
translated: nor the accomplishments of yoga, nor even the state of non-return,🔽does one whose self is dedicated to Me desire, apart from Me.

original: mayy arpitātmā maddhyānaniṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: mayi arpita ātmā mad dhyāna niṣṭhaḥ
translated: One whose self is dedicated to Me is one who is devoted to the meditation on Me.

original: tyāgād vaitṛṣṇyād anantaram eva śāntir madrūpaguṇādikaṃ vinā sarvaviṣayeṣv evendriyāṇām uparatiḥ /
analyzed: tyāgāt vaitṛṣṇyāt anantaram eva śāntiḥ mad rūpa guṇa ādikam vinā sarva viṣayeṣu eva indriyāṇām uparatiḥ
translated: Immediately after renunciation, which is non-attachment, there is peace, which is the cessation of the senses from all objects other than Me, My form, qualities, etc.

original: atra pūrvārdhe śreyaḥ iti viśiṣyate iti padadvayenānvayād uttarārdhe tu anantaram ity anenaivānvayād eṣaiva vyākhyā samyag upapadyate nānyety
analyzed: atra pūrva ardhe śreyaḥ iti viśiṣyate iti pada dvayena anvayāt uttara ardhe tu anantaram iti anena eva anvayāt eṣā eva vyākhyā samyak upapadyate na anyā iti
translated: Here, in the first half, the word śreyaḥ is specifically mentioned, so the explanation is correct only by this, not by any other, because it is connected with the two words iti.

original: avadheyam ////
analyzed: avadheyam
translated: This should be noted.

original: baladevaḥ sukaratvād apramādatvāj jñānagarbhatvāc cānibhisaṃhitaṃ phalaṃ karmayogaṃ stauti śreyo hīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ sukara tvāt apramāda tvāt jñāna garbha tvāt ca an ibhisaṃhitam phalam karmayogam stauti śreyaḥ hi iti
translated: Baladeva praises the yoga of action, whose result is not mixed with other things, because it is easy to perform, because it is not subject to negligence, and because it is full of knowledge, with the words śreyaḥ hi etc.

original: abhyāsān matsmṛtisātatyarūpād aniṣpannāj jñānaṃ svātmasākṣātkṛtirūpaṃ śreyaḥ praśastataram /
analyzed: abhyāsāt mad smṛti sātatya rūpāt a niṣpannāt jñānam svātma sākṣātkṛti rūpam śreyaḥ praśastataram
translated: Knowledge, which is the realization of one's own Self, is more praiseworthy than the practice of constant remembrance of Me, which is not yet perfected.

original: paramātmopalabdhidvāratvāt jñānāc ca tasmād aniṣpannāt sādhanabhūtaṃ dhyānaṃ svātmacintanalakṣaṇaṃ viśiṣyate svahitatve śreyo bhavati
analyzed: paramātma upalabdhi dvāra tvāt jñānāt ca tasmāt aniṣpannāt sādhana bhūtam dhyānam sva ātma cintana lakṣaṇam viśiṣyate sva hita tve śreyaḥ bhavati
translated: And from that knowledge which is not yet accomplished, meditation which has the characteristic of self-contemplation, which is the means, is distinguished. It becomes the highest good in the matter of one's own welfare.

original: dhyānāc ca tasmād aniṣpannāt karmaphalatyāgād anantaraṃ śāntis tyaktaphalād anuṣṭhitā karmaṇo 'nantaraṃ manaḥśuddhir ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dhyānāt ca tasmāt aniṣpannāt karma phala tyāgāt anantaram śāntiḥ tyakta phalāt anuṣṭhitā karmaṇaḥ nantaram manaḥśuddhiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: And from that meditation which is not yet accomplished, comes peace, the purification of the mind, which is the result of the renunciation of the fruits of action, the performance of action without attachment to its fruits.

original: tathā ca śuddhe manasi dhyānaṃ niṣpadyate /
analyzed: tathā ca śuddhe manasi dhyānam niṣpadyate
translated: And thus, when the mind is purified, meditation is accomplished.

original: niṣpanne dhyāne svasākṣātkṛtirūpaṃ jñānaṃ /
analyzed: niṣpanne dhyāne sva sākṣātkṛti rūpam jñānam
translated: When meditation is accomplished, there is knowledge in the form of self-realization.

original: jñāne niṣpanne tatphalabhūtaṃ paramātmajñānam /
analyzed: jñāne niṣpanne tad phala bhūtam paramātma jñānam
translated: When knowledge is accomplished, there is the knowledge of the Supreme Self which is its fruit.

original: tena parā bhaktis tayiśvaryapradhānasya mama prāptir iti durgamo 'yam upāya iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tena parā bhaktiḥ tad yiśvarya pradhānasya mama prāptiḥ iti durgamaḥ yam upāyaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: By that, there is the highest devotion, and by that, I who am the Lord attain Him. Thus, this is a difficult means. This is the idea.

original: na cāyam arjunaṃ praty upadeśas
analyzed: na ca ayam arjunam prati upadeśaḥ
translated: And this is not an instruction addressed to Arjuna.

original: tasyaikāntitvāt /🔽sanniṣṭhā niṣkāmakarmaratā haridhyāyinaś ca svātmānam anubhūya tato 'bhyuditayā
analyzed: tasya ekānti tvāt  sanniṣṭhāḥ niṣkāma karma ratāḥ hari dhyāyinaḥ ca sva ātmānam anubhūya tatas bhyuditayā
translated: Because he is one-pointed.

original: hariviṣayakatyā pāramaiśvaryaguṇayā parayā bhaktyā hariṃ premāspadam anubhavanto
analyzed: pāramaiśvarya guṇayā parayā bhaktyā harim prema āspadam
translated: Those who are devoted to the performance of action without desire, and who meditate on Hari, experience their own Self, and then, by the supreme devotion which is the result of that, which has as its object Hari's supreme glory, they experience Hari as the object of love.

original: vimucyanta iti gītāśāstrārthapaddhatiḥ /
analyzed: vimucyante iti gītā śāstra artha paddhatiḥ
translated: The purport of the Gita scriptures is that they are liberated.

original: kintv ekāntitvāsaktaṃ pratītibodhyam ////
analyzed: kintu ekānti tva āsaktam pratīti bodhyam
translated: But this should be understood to be for one who is devoted to monism.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: adveṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca /
analyzed: a dveṣṭā sarva bhūtānām maitraḥ karuṇaḥ eva ca
translated: He who is free from hatred towards all beings, friendly, compassionate,

original: nirmamo nirahaṃkāraḥ samaduḥkhasukhaḥ kṣamī ////
analyzed: nirmamaḥ nirahaṃkāraḥ sama duḥkha sukhaḥ kṣamī
translated: free from sense of possession, free from egoism, equanimous in pain and pleasure, and forgiving,

original: saṃtuṣṭaḥ satataṃ yogī yatātmā dṛḍhaniścayaḥ /
analyzed: saṃtuṣṭaḥ satatam yogī yata ātmā dṛḍha niścayaḥ
translated: always contented, a yogi, self-controlled, firm in resolve,

original: mayy arpitamanobuddhir yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ////
analyzed: mayi arpita manaḥ buddhiḥ yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: whose mind and intellect are dedicated to Me - he who is a devotee of Mine is dear to Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ evaṃbhūtasya bhaktasya kṣipram eva parameśvaraprasādahetūn dharmān āha adveṣṭety aṣṭabhiḥ /
translated: Shridhar: For the devotee who is such, the Lord states the qualities that are the causes of the grace of the Supreme Lord, with the eight verses beginning with free from hatred.

original: sarvabhūtānāṃ yathāyatham adveṣṭā maitraḥ karuṇaś ca /
analyzed: sarva bhūtānām yathāyatham a dveṣṭā maitraḥ karuṇaḥ ca
translated: He is free from hatred towards all beings, friendly, and compassionate, according to their respective positions.

original: uttameṣu dveṣaśūnyaḥ /
analyzed: uttameṣu dveṣa śūnyaḥ
translated: He is free from hatred towards the superior ones.

original: sameṣu mitratayā vartata iti maitraḥ /
analyzed: sameṣu mitra tayā vartate iti maitraḥ
translated: He is friendly towards those of equal status.

original: hīneṣu kṛpālur ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: hīneṣu kṛpāluḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: He is compassionate towards the inferior ones - this is the meaning.

original: nirmamo nirahaṃkāraś ca kṛpālutvād eva anyaiḥ saha same duḥkhasukhe yasya saḥ /
analyzed: nirmamaḥ nirahaṃkāraḥ ca kṛpālu tvāt eva anyaiḥ saha same duḥkha sukhe yasya saḥ
translated: He is free from sense of possession and free from egoism, due to compassion itself. He is equanimous in pain and pleasure.

original: kṣamī kṣamāśīlaḥ ////🔽saṃtuṣṭa iti /
analyzed: kṣamī kṣamā śīlaḥ  saṃtuṣṭaḥ iti
translated: He is forgiving, of forgiving nature.🔽Always contented.

original: satataṃ lābhe 'lābhe ca saṃtuṣṭaḥ suprasannacittaḥ /
analyzed: satatam lābhe lābhe ca saṃtuṣṭaḥ su prasanna cittaḥ
translated: Always contented, with a very happy mind, whether there is gain or no gain.

original: yogī apramattaḥ yatātmā saṃyatasvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yogī apramattaḥ yata ātmā saṃyata svabhāvaḥ
translated: The yogi is heedful, self-controlled, and disciplined by nature.

original: dṛḍho madviṣayo yasya /
analyzed: dṛḍhaḥ mad viṣayaḥ yasya
translated: The yogi is one who is not negligent, who has a controlled self, who has a restrained nature.🔽One who is firm in his devotion to Me.

original: mayy arpite manobuddhī yena /
analyzed: mayi arpite manaḥ buddhī yena
translated: One whose mind and intellect are dedicated to Me.

original: evaṃbhūto yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ////
analyzed: evaṃbhūtaḥ yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: Such a devotee of Mine is dear to Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ tad evaṃ mandam adhikāriṇaṃ pratyatiduṣkaratvenākṣaropāsananindayā🔽sukaraṃ saguṇopāsanaṃ vidhāyāśaktitāratamyānuvādenānyāny api sādhanāni vidadhau
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ tat evam mandam adhikāriṇam prati ati duṣkara tvena akṣara upāsana nindayā  sukaram sa guṇa upāsanam vidhāya aśakti tāratamya anuvādena anyāni api sādhanāni vidadhau
translated: Madhusudana: Thus, having praised the meditation with qualities as easy, by criticizing the meditation on the imperishable as extremely difficult for a slow-witted person,🔽and having mentioned the gradation of incapacity, the Blessed Lord Vasudeva,

original: bhagavān vāsudevaḥ kathaṃ nu nāma sarvapratibandharahitaḥ sann uttamādhikāritayā
analyzed: bhagavān vāsudevaḥ katham nu nāma sarva pratibandha rahitaḥ san uttama adhikāri tayā
translated: with the intention of how to enter into the imperishable knowledge which is the result, being free from all obstacles, as the best qualified person,

original: phalabhūtāyām akṣaravidyāyām avatared ity abhiprāyeṇa sādhanavidhānasya phalārthatvāt / tad uktam 🔽nirviśeṣaṃ paraṃ brahma sākṣātkartum anīśvarāḥ /
analyzed: phala bhūtāyām akṣaravidyāyām avataret iti abhiprāyeṇa sādhana vidhānasya phala artha tvāt tat uktam  nirviśeṣam param brahma sākṣātkartum anīśvarāḥ
translated: since the injunction of the means has the purpose of the result, as stated:🔽Those slow-witted ones who are unable to directly realize the supreme Brahman without distinctions,

original: ye mandās te 'nukampyante saviśeṣanirūpaṇaiḥ //
analyzed: ye mandāḥ te nu kampyante sa viśeṣa nirūpaṇaiḥ
translated: they are pitied by the descriptions with distinctions.

original: vaśīkṛte manasy eṣāṃ saguṇabrahmaśīlanāt /
analyzed: vaśīkṛte manasi eṣām sa guṇa brahma śīlanāt
translated: When their minds are controlled, by practicing Brahman with qualities,

original: tad evāvirbhavet sākṣād apetopādhikalpanam // iti /
analyzed: tat eva āvirbhavet sākṣāt apeta upādhi kalpanam iti
translated: that very [Brahman] will manifest directly, free from the conceptualizations of limiting adjuncts.

original: bhagavatā patañjalinā coktaṃ samādhisiddhir īśvarapraṇidhānāt iti /
analyzed: bhagavatā patañjalinā ca uktam samādhi siddhiḥ īśvara praṇidhānāt iti
translated: And it has been said by the revered Patañjali: “The perfection of concentration comes from the devotion to God.”

original: tataḥ pratyakcetanādhigamo 'py antarāyābhāvaś ca iti ca /
analyzed: tatas antarāya abhāvaḥ ca iti ca
translated: And also: “From that, the realization of the supreme Self and the absence of obstacles.”

original: tata itīśvarapraṇidhānād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas iti īśvara praṇidhānāt iti arthaḥ
translated: From that means from the devotion to God.

original: tad evam akṣaropāsananindā saguṇopāsanastutaye na tu heyatayā /
analyzed: tat evam akṣara upāsana nindā saguṇa upāsana stutaye na tu heya tayā
translated: Thus, the condemnation of the meditation on the Imperishable is for the praise of the meditation with attributes, not for the purpose of being abandoned.

original: uditahomavidhāvanuditahomanindāvat /
analyzed: udita homa vidhau anudita homa nindā vat
translated: Like the condemnation of the morning oblation in the injunction of the evening oblation.

original: na hi nindā nindyaṃ nindituṃ pravartate 'pi tu vidheyaṃ stotum iti nyāyāt /
analyzed: na hi nindā nindyam ninditum pravartate tu vidheyam stotum iti nyāyāt
translated: For the rule is that condemnation does not proceed to condemn what is to be condemned, but rather to praise what is to be enjoined.

original: tasmād akṣaropāsakā eva paramārthato yogavittamāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt akṣara upāsakāḥ eva paramārthataḥ yoga vittamāḥ
translated: Therefore, only the meditators on the Imperishable are the best knowers of Yoga in the highest sense.

original: priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ /
analyzed: priyaḥ hi jñāninaḥ tyartham aham sa ca mama priyaḥ
translated: For I am very dear to the knowers of the field, and he is dear to Me.

original: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam // Gītā /
analyzed: udārāḥ sarve eva ete jñānī tu ātmā eva me matam gītā
translated: All of them are noble, but the knower of the field is considered by Me to be My very Self.

original: ity ādinā punaḥ punaḥ praśastatamatayoktās teṣām eva jñānaṃ dharmajātaṃ cānusaraṇīyam
analyzed: iti ādinā punar punar praśastatama tayā uktāḥ teṣām eva jñānam dharma jātam ca anusaraṇīyam
translated: Thus, being praised again and again as the most excellent, their knowledge and the host of virtues should be followed.

original: adhikāram āsādya tvayety arjunaṃ bubodhayiṣuḥ paramahitaiṣī bhagavān abhedadarśinaḥ
analyzed: adhikāram āsādya tvayā iti arjunam bubodhayiṣuḥ parama hita eṣī bhagavān abheda darśinaḥ
translated: Desiring to instruct Arjuna, the supremely beneficent Lord, having attained the right to speak,

original: kṛtakṛtyānakṣaropāsakān prastauti adveṣṭeti saptabhiḥ /
analyzed: kṛtakṛtya anakṣara upāsakān prastauti a dveṣṭā iti saptabhiḥ
translated: He praises the accomplished, silent, and devoted disciples with seven verses beginning with He who is free from hatred.

original: sarvāṇi bhūtāny ātmatvena paśyann ātmano duḥkhahetāv api pratikūlabuddhyabhāvān na dveṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ kintu maitrī snigdhatā tadvān /
analyzed: sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātma tvena paśyan ātmanaḥ duḥkha hetau api pratikūla buddhi abhāvāt na dveṣṭā sarva bhūtānām kintu maitrī snigdha tā tadvān
translated: Seeing all beings as his own self, he does not hate any being, even the cause of his own suffering, because he has no contrary thoughts. But he has friendliness, affection, towards all beings.

original: yataḥ karuṇaḥ karuṇā duḥkhiteṣu dayā tadvān sarvabhūtābhayadātā paramahaṃsaparivrājaka ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: yatas karuṇaḥ karuṇā duḥkhiteṣu dayā tadvān sarva bhūta abhaya dātā paramahaṃsa parivrājakaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Because he is compassionate, compassion is pity for the suffering, he has that, and he is the giver of fearlessness to all beings, the meaning is that he is a supreme wandering renunciant.

original: nirmamo dehe 'pi mameti pratyayarahitaḥ /
analyzed: nirmamaḥ dehe mama iti pratyaya rahitaḥ
translated: He is free from the sense of ownership, even in the body, free from the notion of mine.

original: nirahaṅkāro vṛttasvādhyāyādikṛtāhaṅkārān niṣkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: nirahaṅkāraḥ vṛtta svādhyāya ādi kṛta ahaṅkārāt niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: He is free from egotism, having gone beyond the egotism produced by the study of one's own duties and so on.

original: dveṣarāgayor apravartakatvena same duḥkhasukhe yasya saḥ /
analyzed: dveṣa rāgayoḥ a pravartaka tvena same duḥkha sukhe yasya saḥ
translated: He is the same in pain and pleasure, because he does not engage in hatred and passion.

original: ataeva kṣamī ākrośanatāḍanādināpi na vikriyām āpadyate ////
analyzed: ataeva kṣamī ākrośana tāḍana ādinā api na vikriyām āpadyate
translated: For that very reason, he is patient, not undergoing any change even by being scolded, beaten, and so on.

original: tasyaiva viśeṣaṇāntarāṇi santuṣṭa iti /
analyzed: tasya eva viśeṣaṇa antarāṇi santuṣṭaḥ iti
translated: The other qualifications of him are stated with contented.

original: satataṃ śarīrasthitikāraṇasya lābhe 'lābhe ca saṃtuṣṭaḥ utpannālaṃpratyayaḥ /
analyzed: satatam śarīra sthiti kāraṇasya lābhe lābhe ca saṃtuṣṭaḥ utpanna alaṃpratyayaḥ
translated: He is contented with the gain or non-gain of the means of maintaining the body, always having the notion of enough is produced.

original: tathā guṇavallābhe viparyaye ca /
analyzed: tathā guṇavat lābhe viparyaye ca
translated: Similarly, with the gain of good qualities and the opposite.

original: satatam iti sarvatra sambadhyate /
analyzed: satatam iti sarvatra sambadhyate
translated: Always is to be connected everywhere.

original: yogī samāhitacittaḥ /
analyzed: yogī samāhita cittaḥ
translated: The yogi is one whose mind is concentrated.

original: yatātmā saṃyataśarīrendriyādisaṃghātaḥ /
analyzed: yata ātmā saṃyata śarīra indriya ādi saṃghātaḥ
translated: One who has controlled the body, senses, etc., is one whose self is controlled.

original: dṛḍhaḥ kutārkikair abhibhavitum aśakyatayā sthiro niścayo 'ham asmy akaartrabhloktṛsaccidānandādvitīyaṃ brahmety adhyavasāyo yasya sa dṛḍhaniścayaḥ
analyzed: dṛḍhaḥ ku tārkikaiḥ abhibhavitum aśakya tayā sthiraḥ niścayaḥ ham asmi brahma iti adhyavasāyaḥ yasya sa dṛḍha niścayaḥ
translated: One who has firm conviction, i.e., one who is firmly convinced that I am Brahman, the secondless Truth, Consciousness, Bliss, without an agent or an experiencer, is one of firm conviction.

original: sthitaprajña ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sthita prajñaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning of one of steadfast wisdom.

original: mayi bhagavati vāsudeve śuddhe brahmaṇi arpitamanobuddhiḥ samarpitāntaḥkaraṇaḥ /
analyzed: mayi bhagavati vāsudeve śuddhe brahmaṇi arpita manaḥ buddhiḥ samarpita antaḥkaraṇaḥ
translated: One whose mind and intellect are dedicated to Me, the Blessed Lord Vāsudeva, the pure Brahman, is one who has dedicated his inner organs.

original: īdṛśo yo madbhaktaḥ śuddhākṣarabrahmavit sa me priyaḥ /
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ śuddha akṣara brahma vid sa me priyaḥ
translated: Such a devotee of Mine, who knows the pure imperishable Brahman, is dear to Me.

original: madātmatvāt ////
analyzed: mad ātma tvāt
translated: Because he has become one with Me.

original: viśvanāthaḥ etādṛśyāḥ śāntyā bhaktaḥ kīdṛśo bhavatīty apekṣāyāṃ bahuvidhabhaktānāṃ svabhāvabhedān āha adveṣṭety aṣṭabhiḥ /
translated: Viśvanātha: Desiring to know what kind of devotee one becomes through such peace, he mentions the various natures of devotees with eight verses beginning with adveṣṭā.

original: adveṣṭā dviṣatsv api dveṣaṃ na karoti pratyuta mitro mitratayā vartate /
analyzed: a dveṣṭā dviṣatsu api dveṣam na karoti pratyuta mitraḥ mitra tayā vartate
translated: One who does not hate even haters, but rather treats them as friends.

original: karuṇa eṣām asadgatir mā bhavatv iti buddhyā teṣu kṛpāluḥ /
analyzed: karuṇaḥ eṣām asat gatiḥ mā bhavatu iti buddhyā teṣu kṛpāluḥ
translated: Compassionate, thinking May they not go to bad destinies.

original: nanu kīdṛśena vivekena dviṣatsv api maitrīkāruṇye syātām /
analyzed: nanu kīdṛśena vivekena dviṣatsu api maitrī kāruṇye syātām
translated: But how can there be friendliness and compassion towards haters through such discrimination?

original: tatra vivekaṃ vinaivety āha nirmamo nirahaṃkāra iti putrakalatrādiṣu mamatvābhāvād dehe cāhaṅkārābhāvāt tasya madbhaktasya kvāpi dveṣa eva
analyzed: tatra vivekam vinā eva iti āha nirmamaḥ nirahaṃkāraḥ iti putra kalatra ādiṣu mamatva abhāvāt dehe ca ahaṅkāra abhāvāt tasya mad bhaktasya kvāpi dveṣaḥ eva
translated: There, without discrimination, he says, free from the sense of my and mine, due to the absence of the sense of possession towards sons, wife, etc., and the absence of egoism in the body, that devotee of mine has no hatred anywhere.

original: naiva phalati /
analyzed: na eva phalati
translated: To that end, he says, without discrimination, he is free from the sense of mine and the sense of I. Since he, my devotee, has no sense of possession towards sons, wife, etc., and no sense of I towards the body, his aversion does not bear fruit anywhere.

original: kutaḥ punar dveṣajanitaduḥkhaśāntyarthaṃ tena vivekaḥ svīkartavya iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: kutas punar dveṣa janita duḥkha śānti artham tena vivekaḥ svīkartavyaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: How then can discrimination be accepted by him for the sake of alleviating the suffering born of aversion? This is the idea.

original: nanu tad apy anyakṛtapādukamuṣṭiprahārādibhir dehavyathādīnaṃ duḥkhaṃ kiṃcid bhavaty eva /
analyzed: nanu tat api anya kṛta pāduka muṣṭi prahāra ādibhiḥ deha vyathā dīnam duḥkham kiṃcid bhavati eva
translated: But even that, due to the blows of shoes and fists struck by others, etc., some suffering in the form of bodily pain and so on does indeed occur.

original: tatrāha samaduḥkhasukham /
analyzed: tatra āha sama duḥkha sukham
translated: To that, he says, he is the same in sorrow and joy.

original: yad uktaṃ bhagavatā candrārdhaśekhareṇa
analyzed: yat uktam bhagavatā candra ardha śekhareṇa
translated: What has been said by Lord Chandra-Ardha-Shekhara:

original: nārāyaṇaparāḥ sarve na kutaścana bibhyati /
analyzed: nārāyaṇa parāḥ sarve na kutaścana bibhyati
translated: All those who are devoted to Narayana are not afraid of anything.

original: svargāpavarganarakeṣv api tulyārthadarśinaḥ // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: svarga apavarga narakeṣu api tulya artha darśinaḥ bhp iti
translated: They view heaven, liberation, and hell as having the same purpose.

original: sukhaduḥkhayoḥ sāmyaṃ samadarśitvam /
analyzed: sukha duḥkhayoḥ sāmyam sama darśi tvam
translated: Equality of sorrow and joy is equanimity.

original: tac ca mama prārabdhaphalam idam avśyabhogyam iti bhāvanāmayam /
analyzed: tat ca mama prārabdha phalam idam iti bhāvanā mayam
translated: And that is born of the thought, This is the result of my past actions that must be necessarily experienced.

original: sāmye 'pi sahiṣṇuvaiva duḥkhaṃ sahyata ity āha kṣamī kṣamavān /
analyzed: sāmye pi sahiṣṇuvā eva duḥkham sahyate iti āha kṣamī kṣamavān
translated: Even in equality, only the patient can bear suffering. Thus he says, he is forbearing, possessing forbearance.

original: kṣam sahane dhātuḥ /
analyzed: kṣam sahane dhātuḥ
translated: The root kshama means to endure.

original: nanv etādṛśasya bhaktasya jīvikā kathaṃ sidhyet /
analyzed: nanu etādṛśasya bhaktasya jīvikā katham sidhyet
translated: But how can a devotee of this kind maintain his livelihood?

original: tatrāha santuṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tatra āha santuṣṭaḥ
translated: To that he says, contented.

original: yadṛcchopasthite kiṃcid yatnopasthite vā bhakṣyavastuni santuṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yadṛcchā upasthite kiṃcid yatna upasthite vā bhakṣya vastuni santuṣṭaḥ
translated: Content with whatever foodstuff that comes by chance or with some effort.

original: nanu samaduḥkhasukham ity uktam /
analyzed: nanu sama duḥkha sukham iti uktam
translated: But it has been said that he is equal in happiness and sorrow.

original: tat kathaṃ svabhakṣam ālakṣya santuṣṭa iti tatrāha satataṃ yogī bhaktiyogayukto bhaktisiddhārtham iti bhāvaḥ / yad uktaṃ
analyzed: tat katham sva bhakṣam ālakṣya santuṣṭaḥ iti tatra āha satatam yogī bhakti yoga yuktaḥ bhakti siddhārtham iti bhāvaḥ yat uktam
translated: How then is he contented on seeing his own food? To that he says, always a yogi, endowed with the yoga of devotion, for the sake of accomplishing devotion, is the idea. As it has been said:

original: āhārārthaṃ yatataiva yuktaṃ tatprāṇadhāraṇam /
analyzed: āhāra artham yatatā eva yuktam tat prāṇadhāraṇam
translated: It is proper that one who strives for the sake of food should maintain his life.

original: tattvaṃ vimṛśyate tena tad vijñāya paraṃ vrajet // iti /
analyzed: tattvam vimṛśyate tena tat vijñāya param vrajet iti
translated: By that, the truth is examined, having known that, one should go to the supreme.

original: kiṃ ca deivād aprāptabhaikṣyo 'pi yatātmā saṃyatacittaḥ kṣobharahita ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca yata ātmā saṃyata cittaḥ kṣobha rahitaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Moreover, even if he does not get alms by chance, he is self-controlled, his mind is restrained, the meaning is he is free from agitation.

original: daivāc cittakṣobhe saty api tadupaśamārtham aṣṭāṅgayogābhyāsādikaṃ naiva karotīty āha dṛḍhaniścayo 'nanyabhaktir eva me kartavyeti niścayas
analyzed: daivāt citta kṣobhe sati api tad upaśama artham aṣṭāṅga yoga abhyāsa ādikam nā eva karoti iti āha dṛḍha niścayaḥ eva me kartavyā iti niścayaḥ
translated: Even if there is agitation of the mind by chance, he does not at all perform the practice of the eight-limbed yoga etc. for the sake of pacifying it. He says, firmly resolved, his resolve that devotion to Me alone is to be done

original: tasya na śithilībhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: tasya na śithilībhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: does not become loose, is the meaning.

original: sarvatra hetuḥ mayy arpitamanobuddhir matsmaraṇamananaparāyaṇa ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra hetuḥ mayi arpita manaḥ buddhiḥ mad smaraṇa manana parāyaṇaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: everywhere, with his mind and intellect dedicated to Me, intent on remembering and reflecting on Me.

original: īdṛśo bhaktas tu me priyo mām atiprīṇayatīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ bhaktaḥ tu me priyaḥ mām atiprīṇayati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: such a devotee is dear to Me, he delights Me very much.

original: baladevaḥ evam ekāntibhaktān pariniṣṭhitādīn anekāntibhaktān saniṣṭhāṃś ca tattatsādhanabhedair upavarṇya teṣāṃ sarvoparañjakān guṇān
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam ekānti bhaktān pariniṣṭhita ādīn anekānti bhaktān saniṣṭhān ca tad tad sādhana bhedaiḥ upavarṇya teṣām sarva uparañjakān guṇān
translated: Balarama, having described the devotees who are exclusively devoted, who are fully surrendered, and who are not exclusively devoted, who are partially surrendered, with their respective means, now presents their qualities, which surpass all others,

original: vidadhāti adveṣṭeti saptabhiḥ /
analyzed: vidadhāti a dveṣṭā iti saptabhiḥ
translated: with seven verses beginning with He who is free from hatred.

original: sarvabhūtānām adveṣṭā dveṣaṃ kurvatsv api teṣu matprārabhdānuguṇapareśapreritāny amūni mahyaṃ dviṣantīti dveṣaśūnyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva bhūtānām a dveṣṭā dveṣam kurvatsu api teṣu mad prārabhda anuguṇa para īśa preritāni amūni mahyam dviṣanti iti dveṣa śūnyaḥ
translated: He is free from hatred towards all beings, even towards those who hate him, thinking, These are hating Me according to the influence of My previous actions and the Supreme Lord's instigation.

original: pareśādhiṣṭhānāny amūnīti teṣu maitraḥ snigdhaḥ /🔽kenacin nimittena khinneṣu mābhūd eṣāṃ kheda iti karuṇaḥ /
analyzed: pareśa adhiṣṭhānāni amūni iti teṣu maitraḥ snigdhaḥ  kenacid nimittena khinneṣu mā abhūt eṣām khedaḥ iti karuṇaḥ
translated: He is friendly towards them, thinking, These are under the control of the Supreme Lord.🔽He is compassionate, thinking, Let there be no distress for them due to any cause.

original: dehādiṣu nirmamaḥ prakṛter amī vikārā na mameti teṣu mamatāśūnyaḥ /
analyzed: deha ādiṣu nirmamaḥ prakṛteḥ amī vikārāḥ na mama iti teṣu mamatā śūnyaḥ
translated: He is free from the sense of ownership towards the body and so on, thinking, These modifications of Prakṛti are not mine, thus devoid of attachment towards them.

original: nirahaṅkāras teṣv ātmābhimānarahitaḥ /
analyzed: nirahaṅkāraḥ teṣu ātma abhimāna rahitaḥ
translated: He is free from egoism, devoid of the sense of self-identification with them.

original: samaduḥkhasukhaḥ sukhe sati harṣeṇa duḥkhe sati udvegena cāvyākulaḥ /
analyzed: sama duḥkha sukhaḥ sukhe sati harṣeṇa duḥkhe sati udvegena ca avyākulaḥ
translated: He is unperturbed by happiness or sorrow, not agitated by joy when happy or by anxiety when sorrowful.

original: yataḥ kṣamī tattatsahiṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: yatas kṣamī tad tad sahiṣṇuḥ
translated: Because he is forgiving, i.e., he endures all that.

original: satataṃ santuṣṭo lābhe 'lābhe ca prasannacittaḥ /
analyzed: satatam santuṣṭaḥ lābhe lābhe ca prasanna cittaḥ
translated: He is always contented, i.e., his mind is delighted in gain as well as in loss.

original: yato yogī gurūpadiṣṭopāyaniṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: yatas yogī guru upadiṣṭa upāya niṣṭhaḥ
translated: Because the yogi is devoted to the means taught by the guru.

original: yatātmā vijitendriyavargaḥ /
analyzed: yata ātmā vijita indriya vargaḥ
translated: He has a controlled self, i.e., his group of senses is conquered.

original: dṛḍhaniścayo dṛḍhaḥ kutarkair abhibhavitum aśakyatayā sthiro niścayo hareḥ kiṅkaro 'smīti adhyavasāyo yasya saḥ /
analyzed: dṛḍha niścayaḥ dṛḍhaḥ kutarkaiḥ abhibhavitum aśakya tayā sthiraḥ niścayaḥ hareḥ smi iti adhyavasāyaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: He has firm resolve, i.e., he has the determination that is unshakable by any reasoning, and is firm in the resolve that I am the servant of Hari.

original: ato mayy arpitamanobuddhiḥ /
analyzed: atas mayi arpita manaḥ buddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, he has dedicated his mind and intellect to Me.

original: evaṃbhūto yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ prītikartā ////
analyzed: evaṃbhūtaḥ yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ prīti kartā
translated: Such a devotee of Mine is dear to Me, the bestower of joy.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate ca yaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt na udvijate lokaḥ lokāt na udvijate ca yaḥ
translated: He from whom the world does not tremble, and who does not tremble before the world,

original: harṣāmarṣabhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ ////
analyzed: harṣa amarṣa bhaya udvegaiḥ muktaḥ yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
translated: and who is free from joy, anger, fear and anxiety, he is dear to Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ kiṃ ca yasmād iti /🔽yasmāt sakāśāl loko jano nodvijate bhayaśaṅkayā saṃkṣobhaṃ na prāpnoti /
analyzed: ca   iti  yasmāt sakāśāt lokaḥ janaḥ na udvijate bhaya śaṅkayā saṃkṣobham na prāpnoti
translated: Shridhar: What is more, he from whom, etc.🔽From whom the world, the people, do not tremble, do not experience agitation out of fear.

original: yaś ca lokān nodvijate /🔽yaś ca svābhāvikair harṣādibhir yuktaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca lokān na udvijate  yaḥ ca svābhāvikaiḥ harṣa ādibhiḥ yuktaḥ
translated: And he who does not tremble before the world.🔽And he who is endowed with natural joy, etc.

original: tatra harṣaḥ svasyeṣṭalābha utsāhaḥ /
analyzed: tatra harṣaḥ svasya iṣṭa lābhaḥ utsāhaḥ
translated: There, joy is enthusiasm upon one's own gain of what is desirable.

original: amarṣaḥ parasya lābhe 'sahanam /
analyzed: amarṣaḥ parasya lābhe sahanam
translated: Anger is intolerance towards another's gain.

original: bhayaṃ trāsaḥ /
analyzed: bhayam trāsaḥ
translated: Fear is fright.🔽Anxiety is mental agitation.

original: udvego bhayādinimittaś cittakṣobhaḥ /
analyzed: udvegaḥ bhaya ādi nimittaḥ citta kṣobhaḥ
translated: Udvēga is agitation of the mind caused by fear, etc.

original: etair vimukto yo madbhaktaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ ////
analyzed: etaiḥ vimuktaḥ yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
translated: He who is free from these is dear to Me, who am God.

original: madhusūdanaḥ punas tasyaiva viśeṣaṇāni yasmād iti /🔽yasmāt sarvabhūtābhayadāyinaḥ saṃnyāsino hetor nodvijate na santapyate loko yaḥ kaścid api janaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt sarva bhūta abhaya dāyinaḥ saṃnyāsinaḥ hetoḥ nā udvijate na santapyate lokaḥ yaḥ kaścid api janaḥ
translated: Madhusudana again gives the qualifications of that (man) in the words, 'because, etc.'🔽Because of the man of renunciation who grants fearlessness to all beings, no one in the world is agitated or distressed.

original: tathā lokān niraparādhodvejanaikavratāt khalajanān nodvijate ca yaḥ /
analyzed: tathā lokān niraparādha udvejana eka vratāt khala janāt nā udvijate ca yaḥ
translated: Similarly, he who is not agitated by wicked people who are solely devoted to agitating the innocent,

original: advaitadarśitvāt paramakāruṇikatvena kṣamāśīlatvāc ca /
analyzed: advaita darśi tvāt parama kāruṇika tvena kṣamā śīla tvāt ca
translated: because of his non-dualistic vision and his compassionate nature.

original: kiṃ ca harṣaḥ svasya priyalābhe romāñcāśrupātādihetur ānandābhivyañjakaś cittavṛttiviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca harṣaḥ svasya priya lābhe romāñca aśru pāta ādi hetuḥ ānanda abhivyañjakaḥ cittavṛtti viśeṣaḥ
translated: Moreover, harṣa is a special mental state that causes horripilation, tears, etc., and expresses bliss, on the acquisition of one's own beloved.

original: amarṣaḥ parotkarṣāsahanarūpaś cittavṛttiviśeṣaḥ /
translated: Amarasya is a special mental state in the form of intolerance of the excellence of others.

original: bhayaṃ vyāghrādidarśanādhīnaś cittavṛttiviśeṣas trāsaḥ /
analyzed: bhayam vyāghra ādi darśana adhīnaḥ cittavṛtti viśeṣaḥ trāsaḥ
translated: Bhaya is a special mental state in the form of fear caused by seeing a tiger, etc.🔽Udvēga is a special mental state in the form of agitation, thinking 'how shall I live alone in a deserted place, devoid of all possessions'.

original: udvega ekākī kathaṃ vijane sarvaparigrahaśūnyo jīviṣyāmīty evaṃvidho vyākulatārūpaś cittavṛttiviśeṣas tair harṣāmarṣabhayodvegair mukto
analyzed: udvegaḥ ekākī katham vijane sarva parigraha śūnyaḥ jīviṣyāmi iti evaṃvidhaḥ vyākula tā rūpaḥ cittavṛtti viśeṣaḥ taiḥ harṣa amarṣa bhaya udvegaiḥ muktaḥ
translated: He who is free from these - harṣa, amarṣa, bhaya, and udvēga -

original: yaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ
translated: is dear to Me, who am God.

original: advaitadarśitayā tadayogyatvena tair eva svayaṃ parityakto na tu teṣāṃ tyāgāya svayaṃ vyāpṛta iti yāvat
analyzed: advaita darśi tayā tad ayogya tvena taiḥ eva svayam parityaktaḥ na tu teṣām tyāgāya svayam vyāpṛtaḥ iti yāvat
translated: By the vision of non-duality, they themselves have abandoned those [qualities] due to their unsuitability, but he is not engaged in abandoning them. This is the meaning.

original: tena madbhakta ity anukṛṣyate /
analyzed: tena mad bhaktaḥ iti anukṛṣyate
translated: Therefore, the word 'my devotee' is to be supplied.

original: īdṛśo madbhakto yaḥ sa me priya iti pūrvavat ////
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ mad bhaktaḥ yaḥ sa me priyaḥ iti pūrvavat
translated: Such a devotee of Mine is dear to Me. As before...

original: viśvanāthaḥ kiṃ ca yasyāsti bhaktir bhagavaty akiṃcanā sarvair guṇais tatra samāsate🔽surāḥ BhP / / ityādyukter matprītijanakā anye 'pi guṇā madbhaktyā muhur
analyzed: ca   asti                                                                   surāḥ bhp ityādi ukteḥ mad prīti janakāḥ anye guṇāḥ mad bhaktyā muhur
translated: Viṣṇu: And, since it is said, 'He who has devotion to the Lord, who is free from all desires, all the virtues gather there,'

original: abhyastayā svata evotpadyante /
analyzed: abhyastayā svatas eva utpadyante
translated: and so on, other virtues that generate love for Me arise by themselves through repeated practice of devotion to Me.

original: tān api tvaṃ śṛṇv ity āha /
analyzed: tān api tvam śṛṇu iti āha
translated: But you listen to those also, says [the Lord].

original: yasmād iti pañcabhiḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt iti pañcabhiḥ
translated: With five [verses] beginning with 'yasmat'.

original: harṣādibhIḥ prākṛtair harṣāmarṣabhayodvegair mukta ity ādinoktān api kāṃścid guṇān durlabhatvajñāpanārthaṃ punar āha yo na hṛṣyatīti ////
analyzed: harṣa ādibhiḥ prākṛtaiḥ harṣa amarṣa bhaya udvegaiḥ muktaḥ iti ādinā uktān api kāṃścid guṇān durlabha tva jñāpana artham punar āha yaḥ na hṛṣyati iti
translated: He is free from natural joy, anger, fear, and anxiety, and so on. He says some other virtues again to indicate their rarity, beginning with 'yo na hṛṣyati'.

original: baladevaḥ yasmāl lokaḥ ko 'pi jano nodvijate bhayaśaṅkayā kṣobhaṃ na labhate /
analyzed: baladevaḥ yasmāt lokaḥ kaḥ pi janaḥ na udvijate bhaya śaṅkayā kṣobham na labhate
translated: Balarāma: For what reason? No one in the world is agitated with fear.

original: yaḥ kāruṇikatvāj janodvejakaṃ karma na karoti /
analyzed: yaḥ kāruṇika tvāt jana udvejakam karma na karoti
translated: He does not perform actions that cause people to be distressed, out of compassion.

original: lokāc ca yo nodvijate sarvāvirodhitvaviniścayād yadudvejakaṃ karma loko na karoti /
analyzed: lokāt ca yaḥ nā udvijate sarva avirodhi tva viniścayāt yat udvejakam karma lokaḥ na karoti
translated: And he who is not distressed by the world, because he has ascertained that nothing is in conflict with him, and so the world does not do any distressing action to him.

original: yaś ca harṣādibhiḥ kartṛbhir mukto /
analyzed: yaḥ ca harṣa ādibhiḥ kartṛbhiḥ muktaḥ
translated: And he who is free from agents like joy etc.

original: na tu teṣāṃ mocane svayaṃ vyāpārī /
analyzed: na tu teṣām mocane svayam vyāpārī
translated: But he is not himself engaged in freeing them.

original: atigambhīrātmaratinimagnatvāt tatsparśenāpi rahita ity arthaḥ /
translated: Because he is immersed in the extremely profound bliss of the Self, he is devoid of even the touch of that, is the meaning.

original: tatra svabhogyāgamotsāho harṣaḥ /🔽parabhogyāgamāsahanam amarṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra sva bhogya āgama utsāhaḥ harṣaḥ  para bhogya āgama asahanam amarṣaḥ
translated: There, joy is the enthusiasm for the acquisition of one's own enjoyments.🔽Anger is the inability to bear the acquisition of enjoyments by others.

original: duṣṭasattvadarśanādhīno vitrāsaḥ bhayam /
analyzed: duṣṭa sattva darśana adhīnaḥ vitrāsaḥ bhayam
translated: Fear is the terror dependent on seeing evil beings.

original: kathaṃ nirudyamasya mama jīvanam iti vikṣobhas tūdvegaḥ /
analyzed: katham nirudyamasya mama jīvanam iti vikṣobhaḥ tu udvegaḥ
translated: Anxiety is the agitation thinking, How can I, who am inactive, live?

original: etāś catasraś cittavṛttayaḥ ////
analyzed: etāḥ catasraḥ cittavṛttayaḥ
translated: These four mental activities are...

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita)

original: anapekṣaḥ śucir dakṣa udāsīno gatavyathaḥ /
analyzed: anapekṣaḥ śuciḥ dakṣaḥ udāsīnaḥ gata vyathaḥ
translated: He who is indifferent, pure, skillful, neutral, free from distress,

original: sarvārambhaparityāgī yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ////
analyzed: sarva ārambha parityāgī yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: and has renounced all undertakings - he, being devoted to Me, is dear to Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ kiṃ ca anapekṣa iti /
analyzed: ca   iti
translated: And what is more, he who is indifferent, etc.

original: anapekṣo yadṛcchayopasthite 'py arthe nispṛhaḥ /
analyzed: anapekṣaḥ yadṛcchayā upasthite pi arthe nispṛhaḥ
translated: He who is indifferent is free from desire even for an object that has come by chance.

original: śucir bāhyābhyantaraśaucasampannaḥ /
analyzed: śuciḥ bāhya abhyantara śauca sampannaḥ
translated: He is pure, endowed with external and internal purity.

original: dakṣo 'nalasaḥ /🔽udāsīnaḥ pakṣapātarahitaḥ /
analyzed: dakṣaḥ nalasaḥ  udāsīnaḥ pakṣapāta rahitaḥ
translated: He is skillful, not lazy.

original: gatavyatha ādhiśūnyaḥ /
analyzed: gata vyathaḥ ādhi śūnyaḥ
translated: He is neutral, free from partiality.🔽He is free from distress, devoid of troubles.

original: sarvān dṛṣṭādṛṣṭārthān ārambhānudyamān parityaktuṃ śīlaṃ yasya saḥ /
analyzed: sarvān dṛṣṭa adṛṣṭa arthān ārambhān udyamān parityaktum śīlam yasya saḥ
translated: He who has the habit of giving up all undertakings, seen and unseen, when they are begun.

original: evaṃbhūtaḥ san yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ////
analyzed: evaṃbhūtaḥ san yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: Being such, he who is devoted to Me is dear to Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ kiṃ ca anapekṣa iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ kim ca anapekṣaḥ iti
translated: Madhusudana says: What is more, he is indifferent.

original: nirapekṣaḥ sarveṣu bhogopakaraṇeṣu yadṛcchopanīteṣv api niḥspṛhaḥ /
analyzed: nirapekṣaḥ sarveṣu bhoga upakaraṇeṣu yadṛcchā upanīteṣu api niḥspṛhaḥ
translated: He is indifferent to all means of enjoyment, even when they are presented by chance, and is free from desire.

original: śucibāhyābhyantaraśaucasampannaḥ /
translated: He is endowed with external and internal purity.
